text: in writing. ‒ UKIP MEPs have voted against this technically non-legislative consultation. UKIP do not support the legitimacy of Europol as an institution and do not support the EU concluding agreements with third countries.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- The terms of cooperation governed by the operational and strategic agreement provide for the exchange of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures andinformation on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.Obviously, this agreement is in line with the prospect of Ukraine's accession to the European Union: I therefore voted against this text.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- I approved this report which recommends the approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Ukraine and Europol because this will facilitate and intensify the fight against terrorism and organized crime in addition to contributing tostrengthen international cooperation, particularly in the fight against trafficking in human beings.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing. - Ukraine is an important partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership. The Gabriel report, which I supported today, endorses the agreement on strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine, further strengthening ties with the country and strengthening the common commitment to security and the fight against organized crime. In particular, the approved text will allow for a broader exchange of information on specialist knowledge, reports, strategic analysis results, information on criminal investigation procedures and training activities. Collaboration will be strengthened on issues such as the fight against trafficking in human beings, economic and drug-related crimes, itinerant criminal groups and money laundering. The agreement will also provide for the exchange of personal data, taking into account the guarantees of protection provided by Ukraine and confirmed by the Europol Joint Supervisory Authority.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written.- The proposal refers to the approval of the conclusion of an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.And although, according to Europol, Ukraine occupies an increasingly important place in the fight against organized crime, it is still a country with a conflictive relationship with human rights;criterion that my group takes into account when approving any Cooperation Agreement.On the other hand, the European Parliament has voted on a new Regulation for Europol that will enter into force next year, in which the Cooperation Agreements will be established through a much more transparent procedure than the current one.There are not enough reasons to hastily approve an Agreement with a country for which we do not have sufficient democratic and legal guarantees.I have voted against.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I thank the rapporteur for her work on this report on the Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol.As we have done in the last reports on Europol, I abstained, as did my group, as it makes no sense to approve this now considering that in a few months we will have to adapt it to the general framework of the new Europol agreement.I can agree with the content, but it seems to me that it would have been better to wait until the new Europol framework was approved.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing. - This report on the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol is intended to improve efficiency in the prevention and fight against serious forms of crime. The terms of cooperation governed by the operational and strategic agreement provide for exchanges of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information. on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. In addition, the agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data and this poses a risk to the confidentiality of people whom I refuse. Finally, this agreement is seen by the EU as a prerequisite for Ukraine's accession to the EU, as is the case with many previously presented agreements. So I voted against it.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- Although I have always supported the agreements on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and third countries, in this text I have identified passages that could open up future problems and I therefore preferred to express myself with an abstention.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written. - I voted in favor of this legislative Resolution by which the Parliament approves the draft Council Implementing Decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol. The Agreement provides for an exchange of information to help Europol further deepen its cooperation with Ukraine. Ukraine is a key partner of the EU and increasingly relevant in the fight against organized crime, specifically in terms of drug-related crimes, human trafficking, smuggling and organized crime gangs. The exchange of information with Ukraine will allow the EU to combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively. In addition, the Agreement also broadens cooperation opportunities in areas such as fighting training activities and crime prevention. The signing of this Strategic and Operational Agreement should foster greater coordination between the different strategies and action plans of the EU, its Member States and Ukraine.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report because Parliament approved the conclusion of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol by the European Police Office (Europol).Such agreements may involve the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information.The operational cooperation agreement also covers the exchange of personal data.This agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine allows for the exchange of information, including personal data.The agreement also allows for the exchange of information in the areas of expertise, general situation reports, the results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, crime prevention methods, as well as training, advice and assistance in specific criminal investigations.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: in writing.- The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime.According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups.The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training.Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: in writing.- I supported the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and the European Police Office (Europol), as there is a clear need for operational cooperation between Europol and Ukraine.Ukraine has become an important partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are a prerequisite for the full realization of the objectives of this partnership.According to existing Europol data, Ukraine is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organized crime, especially in relation to drugs and the economy, trafficking in human beings and smuggling, and mobile (traveling) organized crime groups.By exchanging information, the EU, Member States and Ukraine will be able to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively.

name: Biljana BORZAN
text: written.- I support this Report concerning the proposed approval of the conclusion of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which will allow the exchange of information, including the exchange of personal data.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the resolution approving the agreement between Ukraine and Europol on their future cooperation because I firmly believe it may strengthen the fight against organised crime in Europe by enabling parties of the agreement to exchange useful information.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing.- The operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Ukraine and Europol is an act to be welcomed positively, useful to positively strengthen the collaborations in a difficult moment in the history of the Republic of Ukraine, in the framework of the best strategic and operational cooperation between the member states of theEuropean Union and allied countries with a view to improving the efficiency of the fight against terrorism, mafias, smuggling and international crime.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing.- This agreement aims to strengthen operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol in order to improve the effectiveness of the fight against serious forms of crime.The terms of this cooperation provide for the exchange of information including expertise, general reports, the results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on crime prevention methods.However, this agreement also includes exchanges of personal data;it is also part of the negotiations for Ukraine’s accession to the European Union.This is the reason why I voted against this text.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: signed up. - The proposal for operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol provides for the exchange of information in various fields, as well as various reports on certain methods of crime prevention, criminal investigation procedures, and support in certain criminal investigations. Ukraine is an important partner of the European Union in the Eastern Partnership, and it is essential to strengthen relations between Europol and Ukraine in order to achieve the objectives of security and the fight against crime. Ukraine's involvement has proved necessary in the fight against organized crime, especially trafficking in human beings and the illegal introduction of immigrants. I am in favor of this proposal because I am convinced that this exchange of information between Ukraine and Europol will support the fight against organized crime and terrorism, and that Ukraine will become a key partner in this fight against international crime.

name: Cristian-Silviu BUŞOI
text: signed up. - Pursuant to Decisions 2009/371 / JHA and 2009/934 / JHA, Europol is to conclude agreements with third countries and organizations which are included in the list of Decision 2009/935 / JHA. The purpose of these agreements is to support the action of the competent authorities of the Member States and their cooperation in the prevention of organized crime, terrorism or other serious crime. In order to improve the effectiveness of prevention and the fight against serious crime, but especially due to Ukraine's status as a potential candidate and neighboring state of the Union, an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol is absolutely necessary. necessary. I support Marija Gabriel's report, because, in relation to the Ukrainian partner, we need an operational and strategic cooperation agreement that provides for the exchange of information to help prevent crime and the activities that lead to its formation.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of this report because, on a practical level, there is a clear need for Europol to deepen operational cooperation with Ukraine. Ukraine is a key partner of the EU in the framework of the Eastern Partnership and security and the fight against crime are fundamental imperatives in order to fully realize the objectives of the partnership. Ukraine is of increasing importance in the fight against organized crime, and more specifically that related to drugs and economic crime, trafficking in human beings and smuggling, as well as in the fight against mobile organized crime groups. The exchange of information will enable the EU, the Member States and Ukraine to more effectively prevent and fight crime, terrorism and other forms of international organized crime. Beyond the exchange of information, the agreement also opens up opportunities in terms of training and crime prevention activities. The conclusion of this cooperation agreement is a very concrete and important step in making Ukraine a key partner in the fight against organized crime.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP MEPs have voted against this technically non-legislative consultation. UKIP do not support the legitimacy of Europol as an institution and do not support the EU concluding agreements with third countries.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. – I support the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Ukraine, since it would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime, which is international by definition, and would contribute, to enhancing international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing.- The strategic and operational cooperation agreement under consideration between Europol and Ukraine provides for the exchange of information, including information on personal data.By May 2018, both the new Europol regulation and the regulation on the protection of personal data and the directive for the exchange of data in the course of investigations into serious crimes or terrorism will come into force.Furthermore, the new regulation of the Agency for the conclusion of international agreements of strategic cooperation between Europol and third countries ensures greater involvement of the Parliament which will be called upon to express an opinion instead of giving only its consent or not.Pending this possibility, I have decided to abstain.

name: Dita CHARANZOVÁ
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as I am convinced we, as the EU, need to enhance our cooperation with Ukraine, especially in this period. There is a practical point of having better cooperation and exchange of information between Ukraine and Europol. But above that, there is a political and strategic dimension to be understood. Ukraine has been receiving mixed messages from our side lately and we need to reassure them on our partnership.

name: Caterina CHINNICI
text: in writing. - Europol has taken on a key role in fighting cross-border crime and terrorist organizations. It is therefore our duty to facilitate any strategic agreement that contributes to increasing its investigative effectiveness and operational capabilities. I believe that strategic cooperation with Ukraine will be an essential resource for jointly addressing common security challenges in Europe, especially through the exchange of information, the creation of contact points and training programs. I therefore decided to vote in favor of the report as I believe this agreement is particularly important for Ukraine. In fact, the agreement represents a sign of confidence and encouragement for a hoped-for return to stability in the country that is still struggling to overcome a difficult phase in its history. I regret, however, that the European Parliament has not been given a more incisive role in the negotiation of the agreement.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: in writing.- We support the report and strongly support the conclusion of this Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement with Ukraine, as it will help and strengthen the fight against organized crime, which is by definition international, and will contribute to the strengthening of international cooperation in the field.trafficking in human beings and other related criminal matters.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: in writing. - We voted on the report on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol. It is obvious that the reorganizations that we are called to face due to the immigration issue but also to the economic crisis lead to the need for more intense controls. At the same time, however, there are concerns about the practices we want to implement, but also the rights of the citizens we are called to defend. I do not think that this report can cover all the issues sufficiently; that is why I decided to vote against it.

name: Angelo CIOCCA
text: in writing.- Vote of abstention for this report.While confirming the positive value of Europol's cooperation agreements with third countries for the cross-border fight against terrorism and crime, I consider the abstention vote balanced in view of the recent anti-Russian political action that the EU is carrying out in Ukraine.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. - Organized crime and illegality are ontologically indifferent to language, religion, political ideas and, above all, geographical areas. Therefore, I can only invite the Council to conclude an agreement between Ukraine and Europol as quickly as possible for the purpose of operational and strategic cooperation, since positive results can only be achieved through prompt and lively relational and technical exchange. On the one hand, it is essential to accompany Ukraine on its path towards democracy and the full realization of the rule of law and therefore contributions in training, in the exchange of practices and specialist knowledge and in consultancy can support and facilitate crime prevention and resolution of criminal cases. On the other hand, the Romans had already understood the strategic importance of the "Granary of Europe" given its geographical position, which today makes Ukraine a crossroads for drug trafficking, human beings and smuggling, in short, very attractive. for organized crime. The Union has a moral duty to combat these passages, the next move of which is to spread endemic problems well known to the authorities at European level. With my vote, I hope it will be possible to stem and cancel subsistence activities for the underworld.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Ukraine and Europol and noted no objections.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing.- Within the scope of its mandate, Europol can conclude agreements with third countries and other organizations in order to establish avenues for cooperation, especially in the fight against organized crime and terrorism.In this context, it is up to Parliament - given the agreement reached - to consent to its signature by Europol.This gives your consent, demonstrates compliance with all legal requirements and guarantees all safeguards for European citizens.This agreement with Ukraine is of particular importance, as it is consistent and complementary with greater mobility for European and Ukrainian citizens between the two territories.

name: Birgit COLLIN-LANGEN
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report because I support the conclusion of the agreement on strategic and operational cooperation with Ukraine.Ukraine is an important partner for the EU and it plays an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime.The exchange of information will enable the EU, Member States and Ukraine to more effectively prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime.The conclusion of this cooperation agreement is an important step for Ukraine to become a key partner in the fight against organized crime.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing.- I voted in favor as the measure in question is inherent in the proposal to approve the conclusion of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, which includes personal data, the exchange of information which may include specialist knowledge,general reports, strategic analysis results, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods and participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support for individual criminal investigations.Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership and security and the fight against crime are important aspects in order to fully achieve the objectives of the partnership.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written. - I have voted against this Agreement for two key reasons. The first is that I understand that the Europol Agency does not act with the transparency and guarantees that an institution of this type requires. In particular, agreements with third countries do not establish minimum standards in terms of data protection and judicial guarantees, in addition to not being clear about the competencies of the different bodies and the rights to which an investigated person or person would be subject. stopped. On the other hand, the occurrence of this type of Agreement with Ukraine is not accidental, and obeys the strategy of stressing the relationship between the Union and Russia, to which I oppose, in addition to being Ukraine a country with institutions taken over by far right since the coup in 2014, there has been a substantial deterioration in human rights conditions. For both reasons, I have voted against an opaque police agreement without guarantees and, also, with a State with so few democratic guarantees.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing. - The draft Council implementing decision on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol represents an important step forward in the partnership between the EU and Ukraine. This country is a key partner in the fight against international crime and the agreement, which provides for an operational cooperation framework for the exchange of information and personal data, represents an advance in security management at European level. Therefore, I voted in favor of this resolution, because I believe that the agreement reached contributes to improving international cooperation in the fields of trafficking in human beings, criminal matters, the fight against cross-border organized crime and training and prevention activities. crime itself. Furthermore, this cooperation framework is consistent with the rapprochement taking place in other areas, such as the mobility of European and Ukrainian citizens, between Ukraine and EU Member States.

name: Pál CSÁKY
text: in writing. - Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are of paramount importance. According to Europol, Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific drug-related or economic crimes, as well as crimes against human trafficking and smuggling, as well as mobile organized crime groups. The exchange of information will enable the Union, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively, which is particularly important in today's world. The cooperation agreement is also a very decisive and powerful step for Ukraine to become a key partner in the fight against organized crime. In today's vote, I supported the conclusion of a strategic cooperation agreement with Ukraine, as it would help and strengthen the fight against organized crime, which is essentially international in nature, and would help to strengthen international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other relevant crimes.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: in writing.- Considering the status of Ukraine as a country applying for membership in the structures of the European Union, I voted in favor of concluding an agreement between Ukraine and Europol on operational and strategic cooperation.Effective cooperation in security matters is of particular importance in this respect.The main purpose of the agreement is to increase the effectiveness of the actions of the competent state authorities and to coordinate cooperation in the prevention of organized crime, terrorism and other forms of crime.Nowadays, these issues are of particular importance, which motivates to take actions in the area of strengthening operational and strategic systems aimed at ensuring security in Europe.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ I supported Parliament’s consent for the finalisation of a strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Ukraine as I believed this would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of human trafficking and other crimes.  This agreement includes the exchange of valuable information which could enable the EU, through its agency Europol, and Ukraine to prevent and combat organised crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively.

name: William (The Earl of) DARTMOUTH
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP MEPs have voted against this technically non-legislative consultation. UKIP do not support the legitimacy of Europol as an institution and do not support the EU concluding agreements with third countries.

name: Rachida DATI
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this text for the conclusion of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.While Ukraine is an indispensable partner country in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, we must strengthen our cooperation in order to tackle organized crime and terrorism.Strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine should in particular make it possible to step up our action in the fight against trafficking in human beings.We must therefore promote the exchange of information so that we can dismantle the smuggling networks.

name: Andor DELI
text: in writing. - The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime. According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training. Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why, as a member of the FIDESZ People's Party delegation, I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Mark DEMESMAEKER
text: written.- Today the N-VA delegation approved the agreement for operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.We believe that sharing information, including personal data, is essential in the fight against organized crime.Our party has always been a strong advocate of far-reaching operational cooperation with Ukraine and we are therefore pleased that the next step in that direction was taken today.In addition, Ukraine is a reliable and important political and economic partner of the EU in the framework of the Eastern Partnership.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: in writing.- I voted against this report.This is the procedure for concluding an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between the European Commission and Europol.The planned exchanges of information range from information necessary for the fight against organized crime but extend to the exchange of personal data, which we cannot accept.Furthermore, we cannot accept an agreement which serves as a precondition for Ukraine's accession to the European Union.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: in writing. - The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime. According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training. Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why, as a member of the FIDESZ People's Party delegation, I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Jill EVANS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as I believe it will help improve international relations. This will be even more important for Wales now as the UK leaves the EU.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: in writing.- Vote against: agreement unacceptable, it is in line with the prospect of Ukraine's potential accession to the European Union.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - This report proposes the approval of a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Ukraine. The information exchanged may include specific knowledge, reports on the general situation, results of the strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, training activities and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. . Our position regarding the process of federalizing issues of justice and police investigation is well known, the resulting confrontation with fundamental aspects of national sovereignty and the associated lack of democratic control. We advocate cooperation between the internal and external security structures of the various countries. But we reject any federal drive, as this report clearly embodies. On the other hand, this proposal arises in the context of the growing confrontation with the Russian Federation, the intimidating advance of NATO forces along its borders and the existence of an ultra-nationalist and fascist regime in Ukraine promoted by the USA, the EU and NATO. We voted against.

name: Raffaele FITTO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of concluding the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, which includes personal data.Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership and security and the fight against crime are fundamental imperatives in order to fully achieve the objectives of the partnership.I believe that a deepening of operational cooperation with Ukraine is absolutely necessary: a better exchange of information will allow EU Member States and Ukraine to prevent and fight crime, terrorism and other forms of international organized crime more effectively.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing - There has long been a need for a significant deepening of operational cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, as Ukraine is a major partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership.Europol should assist in the fight against money laundering and the active fight against crime.Improving the exchange of information between the European Union and Ukraine will help to fight organized crime and, in particular, smuggling, which has recently spread in the country.The signing of this Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement must promote further coordination between strategies and action plans in the various areas of crime in the European Union and its Member States, on the one hand, and in Ukraine, on the other.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing.- I abstain from the report as EU policy in Ukraine is mainly anti-Russian.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: in writing.- The act demonstrates that commitments in the field of information exchange are subject to either personal will or national security accreditations, with the recent example of the bombers of the terrorist attacks in Paris and Brussels, where Member States' secret services did not inform each other.The agreement does not really reinforce the risk-based approach nor does it guarantee the obligation of data protection by design and default.That is why I am voting against it.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ This proposal concerns the proposed approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, providing for the exchange of information, including personal data. Europol’s Joint Supervisory Body, which consist of the national data protection authorities specialised in law enforcement, gave a positive opinion to the conclusions of this cooperation agreement, taking into account the data protection level in Ukraine. There is clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its operational cooperation with Ukraine. Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime constitute underlying imperatives in order to fully achieve the objectives of this partnership. Thus, I strongly support the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Ukraine, since it would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime, which is international by definition, and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Kinga GÁL
text: in writing. - The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime. According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training. Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why, as a member of the FIDESZ People's Party delegation, I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: in writing. - The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime. According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training. Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why, as a member of the FIDESZ People's Party delegation, I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report which refers to the approval of the conclusion of an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.From an operational point of view, it is clear that Europol needs to intensify its operational cooperation with Ukraine.This country is a key partner of the Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are underlying imperatives in order to fully achieve the objectives of the Eastern Partnership.The exchange of information will enable the Union, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the European Parliament resolution on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, because I think that Ukraine, once internal difficulties have been overcome, will be a key partner of the EU in the fight against terrorism and organized crime. In fact, I believe that the decision of the Council, competent in the matter, to conclude an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol is positive, as this 29-member cooperation can give important results in a number of areas such as trafficking in beings. human beings, arms trafficking, drug trafficking, forgery of identification documents, terrorist financing and the fight against radicalization. The decision also has the effect of bringing this important partner even closer to the EU, with important effects also on the other aspects of the EU-Ukraine bilateral relationship: I am thinking, for example, of the training of police forces, the exchange of good practice, diplomatic cooperation and increasing mobility of citizens on both sides. Finally, I agree with the rapporteur's reference to the subject of personal data and the need to continually update the methods of cooperation in this regard.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- I voted in favor of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol because I consider it important to expand cross-border policing beyond the territory of the EU countries in order to be able to fight international crime effectively.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: written.- In order to protect its citizens, the European Union must not only carry out operational and strategic cooperation among the member states, but also expand this cooperation with third countries.The exchange of strategic information and personal data with Ukraine is not only an important step in protecting our citizens from organized crime and fighting terrorism, but is also an integral part of the strategic Eastern partnership with Ukraine.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I do not support the legitimacy of Europol as an institution and I do not support the EU concluding agreements with third countries, therefore I voted against.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written.- The proposal refers to the approval of the conclusion of an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.And although, according to Europol, Ukraine occupies an increasingly important place in the fight against organized crime, it is still a country with a conflictive relationship with human rights;criterion that my group takes into account when approving any Cooperation Agreement.On the other hand, the European Parliament has voted on a new Regulation for Europol that will enter into force next year, in which the Cooperation Agreements will be established through a much more transparent procedure than the current one.There are not enough reasons to hastily approve an Agreement with a country for which we do not have sufficient democratic and legal guarantees.I have voted against.

name: András GYÜRK
text: in writing.- The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime.According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups.The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training.Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: in writing. - The report concerns the proposed adoption of an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which provides for the exchange of information containing personal data. This information may relate to specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on crime investigation procedures and crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, as well as advice and support in specific criminal investigations. We disagree on both the substance and the procedural issues. In essence, we reject such agreements with third countries, especially when there are no high standards of human rights protection. The agreement could also be seen as a reinforcing tool to put pressure on Russia. It is worth noting that the European Parliament has voted on the new Europol Regulation, which will enter into force next year, on the basis of which such agreements will be discussed more transparently. So the Council's haste to promote these agreements under the old regime worries us. For these reasons we voted against the report.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ This proposal has the objective of supporting and strengthening action by the competent authorities of the Member States and their mutual cooperation in preventing and combating organised crime, terrorism and other forms of serious crime affecting two or more Member States, and may concern the exchange of operational, strategic or technical information, including personal data and classified information. The conclusion of this new international agreement is proposed on the basis of the Europol Council Decision as it is currently in force (Decision 2009/371/JHA). However, the EP and Council have concluded negotiations on a new Regulation for Europol (2013/0091(COD)), in which the procedure for concluding international agreements, as well as the relevant provisions and safeguards for the classification of EU documents or the protection of personal data of European citizens, are significantly modified, which follows the entry into force of the Lisbon Treaty. Therefore, I abstained from the final vote in order to defend the role of the Parliament and ensure proper scrutiny of the agreement.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour since I have no objections

name: György HÖLVÉNYI
text: in writing. - The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime. According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training. Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why, as a member of the FIDESZ People's Party delegation, I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Brice HORTEFEUX
text: in writing.- I am pleased that the European Parliament has authorized the conclusion of a technical, strategic and operational cooperation agreement between Ukraine and Europol.This cooperation is all the more important as Ukraine can be an essential partner in the prevention and fight against organized crime, terrorism and any other serious form of crime such as document fraud which amplifies illegal immigration toEurope.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the Report on the draft Council Implementing Decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Ukraine and Europol (10345/2016 - C8-0267 / 2016 - 2016/0811 (CNS)), withwhereas there is a clear need to deepen Europol's operational cooperation with Ukraine, which is a key EU partner in the Eastern Partnership.Ukraine is important in the fight against organized and drug-related crime, economic crime, human trafficking and smuggling of goods, and other forms of crime.In addition to exchanging information, the agreement opens up other possibilities, such as training and crime prevention activities and encouraging further harmonization of strategies and action plans in various areas of crime.

name: Petr JEŽEK
text: in writing.- Ukraine is a major player in the Eastern Partnership, which is why I consider it necessary to strengthen cooperation with it and to focus more consistently on the fight against crime.I supported the proposal to conclude an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, as it will allow the exchange of classified information, including personal data, in order to prevent crime.The exchange will cover expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on methods.The agreement also includes participation in training and the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Mariya Gabriel on cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.The mission of the Europol agency is to facilitate the exchange of information between European police forces.In this case, it is about strengthening cooperation with Ukraine for the prevention of organized crime, terrorism and the fight against other serious forms of crime.This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report because it aims to support the action of the Member States and their mutual cooperation in the prevention of terrorism, organized crime and other serious forms of crime.The operational and strategic agreement between Ukraine and the European Police Office (Europol) includes provisions on the exchange of personal data, it further expands our cooperation with third countries for the safety of Europeans, whichis essential in these difficult times.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: written.- I abstain from this report because personal data are also to be exchanged here.I expressly welcome international cooperation in the fight against crime, but not at the expense of the personal rights of the citizens of the Member States of the European Union.

name: Kateřina KONEČNÁ
text: in writing.- I have decided to abstain on the proposal for a Council implementing decision approving the conclusion of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and the European Police Office (Europol).Although I am normally in favor of greater police cooperation, I am not entirely sure whether the Ukrainian side is the one that deserves our trust.Ukraine has a large number of problems, including corruption in the highest levels of government, including the police.In addition, I do not believe that the information that the European side would receive would necessarily be entirely true, as it could fulfill orders from the Ukrainian Government.

name: Ádám KÓSA
text: in writing. - The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime. According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training. Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why, as a member of the FIDESZ People's Party delegation, I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Stelios KOULOGLOU
text: in writing. ‒ On 4 October I voted against the agreement between the Europol and the Chinese Ministry of Public Security. Now again we have a similar agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation with Ukraine and of course I voted against to this agreement too. It is important that we are consistent in our approach in regards to this kind of void agreements which do not contribute much to the protection of human rights neither in the EU, nor in our partner countries.

name: Béla KOVÁCS
text: in writing.- Ukraine has more and more opportunities for development and even more needs.Previously, British scientists were of the opinion that one of the strongest bastions of organized crime in Europe is Ukraine, which is preparing to join the EU.Well, this proposal is precisely for the purpose of criminal cooperation in the fight against organized crime and terrorism, which is undoubtedly of pan-European interest.The picture is somewhat nuanced by the fact that, according to the experts cited, the intertwining between law enforcement and criminal structures is also such that sensitive information can even fall into the hands of unauthorized persons.In vain, deepening integration sometimes comes with risks.

name: Andrey KOVATCHEV
text: In written form. - I voted in favor of the report on the draft implementing decision of the Council approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Ukraine and Europol. The proposed report approving the operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine provides for the exchange of information in the field of expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on methods of crime prevention, participation in trainings, consultations and support for specific criminal investigations. I believe that Ukraine is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organized crime, and in particular drug-related and economic crime, human trafficking and smuggling, as well as mobile organized crime groups. The exchange of information will allow the EU, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and fight more effectively against organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime. In addition to exchanging information, the agreement also creates new opportunities, such as training and crime prevention activities. The conclusion of this cooperation agreement is a very concrete and important step for Ukraine to become a key partner in the fight against organized crime.

name: Ilhan KYUCHYUK
text: in writing. ‒ There is no doubt that we should approve the proposed operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, providing for the exchange of information, including personal data. Indeed, there are many reasons why Europol needs to deepen its operational cooperation with Ukraine. First and foremost, Ukraine remains source country for organised crime, more specifically drug related crimes, economic crimes, human trafficking and smuggling. Second, exchange of information will enable the EU, Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organised crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively. Third, reinforced security cooperation between the EU and Ukraine is complementary with the rapprochement taking place in other areas such as the mobility of European and Ukrainian citizens. Last but not least, we should support the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Ukraine, because it will pave the way for Ukraine to become a key EU partner in the fight against organised crime.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing.- I support this report, which analyzes the proposed conclusion of the agreement on strategic operational cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, including personal data.This cooperation aims to provide the exchange of information concerning specific knowledge such as general reports, information on criminal investigation procedures, crime prevention methods, advice and support for individual criminal investigations.Its application date is scheduled for 1 May 2017 and, until then, the provisions in force in the Council Decision on Europol will continue to apply.The exchange of information will enable the EU, Member States and Ukraine to more effectively prevent and combat crime, terrorism and other forms of international organized crime, while also providing benefits in terms of training and crime prevention activities..

name: Marine LE PEN
text: in writing.- I voted against the report on the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.This agreement includes provisions relating to the exchange of personal data of French citizens, which I consider unacceptable.In addition, the conclusion of this agreement is in keeping with the latent view of Ukraine's potential membership of the European Union.However, I am opposed to this idea.I am in favor of better international cooperation between police services, but this cooperation must keep an intergovernmental character.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: in writing.- I voted against this agreement.Of course, it aims to enhance efficiency in preventing and combating serious crime.As such, operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and the European transnational police body Europol provides for exchanges of information, expertise, results of strategic analyzes ... However, this agreement also confirms theexchange of personal data, which I expressly oppose.Finally, this text falls within the - underground - perspective of Ukraine's potential accession to the European Union, which is undesirable.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: written. - I voted in favor of this report because it refers to approving an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information could include specialized information, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, on crime prevention methods, participation in training and counseling activities, and support in individual criminal investigations. The conclusion of this Cooperation Agreement is a very concrete and important step for Ukraine to become a key partner in the fight against organized crime. The signing of this Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement should promote greater coordination between strategies and action plans in the different criminal areas of the Union and its Member States, on the one hand, and Ukraine, on the other.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: written. - I have voted against this Agreement for two key reasons. The first is that I understand that the Europol Agency does not act with the transparency and guarantees that an institution of this type requires. In particular, in agreements with third countries, there are no minimums in terms of data protection and judicial guarantees, in addition to not being clear as to the powers of the different bodies and the rights to which an investigated person or stopped. On the other hand, the occurrence of this type of Agreement with Ukraine is not accidental, and obeys the strategy of stressing the relationship between the Union and Russia, to which I oppose, in addition to being Ukraine a country with institutions taken over by far right since the coup in 2014, there has been a substantial deterioration in human rights conditions. For both reasons, I have voted against an opaque police agreement without guarantees and, furthermore, with a State with so few democratic guarantees.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: written. - This text approves the Council draft approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol. This agreement will provide for the exchange of information, which could include specialized knowledge, results of strategic analysis, information on crime prevention methods and participation in training activities, among others. Bearing in mind that Ukraine is becoming a more and more important actor in the fight against organized crime and, more specifically, in economic crimes, trafficking in human beings and smuggling, and that this Agreement is consistent and complementary to the approach that it is being carried out in areas such as the mobility of European and Ukrainian citizens, I believe that its approval will be very beneficial in preventing and fighting international organized crime, hence the positive sense of my vote.

name: Mairead McGUINNESS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report that strengthens the mutual fight against organised crime.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: written. - This proposal concerns the proposed authorization to conclude an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine which will allow for the exchange of information, including the exchange of personal data. Such information may include expertise, general status reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. According to Europol, Ukraine is increasingly important in the fight against organized crime and more specific drug-related crimes, economic crime, human trafficking and smuggling of goods, as well as against organized crime traveling groups. The Europol Joint Supervisory Body gave a positive opinion on the conclusion of this cooperation agreement, as Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are important priorities for the full achievement of the partnership's objectives. The exchange of information will enable the EU, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively, which is why I supported this report.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: in writing. ‒ Such agreements have the objective of supporting and strengthening action by the competent authorities of the Member States and their mutual cooperation in preventing and combating organised crime, terrorism and other forms of serious crime affecting two or more Member States, and may concern the exchange of operational, strategic or technical information, including personal data and classified information.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: in writing - I consider cooperation with Ukraine in the exchange of information, including personal data, to be crucial for law enforcement, the prevention and investigation of crime and organized crime at the eastern border of the Union.I therefore support the motion for a resolution approving this agreement.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: in writing.- I abstained from voting on the report on the draft executive decision of the Council approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, as it is not complete and substantiated.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: in writing.- I voted against this text.The aim of this report is to give the European Parliament’s agreement on operational cooperation between Europol and Ukraine.In reality, it is about the exchange of personal data of Europeans.This report therefore directly affects the data security of French citizens.This is the reason why we oppose it.In addition, this report is in line with the development of close cooperation between the European Union and Ukraine, considering its potential membership in the future.This idea also provokes our greatest reservations.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. – I voted in favour of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Ukraine and Europol. According to the agreement, the European Union will benefit from strengthening cooperation with Ukraine, a country that plays a crucial role in the Eastern Partnership, security, and countering organized crime. In times when securing the European continent is challenging, exchange of operational, strategic, technical, or classified information will certainly contribute to control terrorism, human trafficking, and other kinds of international malicious activities more effectively.

name: Georg MAYER
text: written.- I abstain, since the current version of the report does not exclude the exchange of personal data between Ukraine and Europol, but such agreements (such as those with Brazil and the United Arab Emirates) are generally to be welcomed.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor because the exchange of information between Europol and the Ukrainian law enforcement authorities would increase the chances of the EU, the Member States and Ukraine more effectively in preventing organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime.The agreement provides opportunities not only for the exchange of information but also for training and crime prevention activities.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: in writing. - Parliament is here "consulted" on the approval of a cooperation agreement between Ukraine and Europol, the European Police Office. At a minimum, it should be ensured that the countries with which the EU concludes such agreements offer all the guarantees of respect for the rule of law, in particular with regard to the judicial system. Especially when it comes to exchanging the personal data of citizens as here. Today's Ukraine, co-ruled by the neo-Nazis, is far from providing such guarantees. Such cooperation is therefore a pure geopolitical choice that I disapprove of. I have already opposed previous similar agreements, notably with the United Arab Emirates. The Council is pushing all these agreements with third countries before the end of 2016 in order to give Europol full latitude for 2017 when its new regulation, even more threatening for the security of our personal data, comes into force. Europol arbitrarily collects personal data in Europe and can refuse to communicate it to the citizens concerned who ask for it. The scandal of the giant espionage revelations by the NSA and the German authorities of governments and European institutions will therefore have been of no use to Brussels. I vote against.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: in writing.- This report on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol is in fact the conclusion of an agreement between the two parties.This agreement provides for the exchange of information including expertise, general reports, the results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on methods of crime prevention, participation in criminal investigations.training activities as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.In addition to these exchanges of information, there are also provisions relating to the exchange of personal data.Being opposed to the communication of personal data, I opposed this agreement which is also done in the more or less concealed perspective of a potential accession of Ukraine to the European Union.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing.- This document concerns the approval of an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.Such information may be in the field of specialized knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation processes, information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, as well as provision of advice and support in certain areas.criminal investigations.Hence my vote in favor.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution because it enables Europol and Ukraine to collaborate by exchanging information that is crucial in preventing and tackling crime, including, information on criminal investigation procedures.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: in writing.- Parliament has been consulted on the conclusion of a strategic cooperation agreement between Ukraine and Europol.This new international agreement strengthens the cooperation that Europol maintains with third countries, which is an essential tool for Europol's work.I would nevertheless like to stress that the conclusion of this agreement should have been made after the entry into force of the new Europol regulation, scheduled for May 2017. The new regulation does indeed provide for enhanced guarantees, particularly in terms of data protection.Moreover, after the entry into force of the new regulation, the European Parliament will benefit from more prerogatives in concluding such international agreements.The role of Parliament in these matters must absolutely be defended.This is why it is important that the conclusion of any new agreement obey the new rules which will soon come into force.

name: Miroslav MIKOLÁŠIK
text: in writing - Ukraine is the largest Eastern Partnership country and an important political partner for the European Union, not least because of the immediate neighborhood. Ukraine's importance to the Union, of course, goes beyond the political framework, as Ukraine participates in many EU projects aimed at kick-starting the economy, promoting competitiveness, science and research, promoting mutual trade, but also culture, lifelong learning (Erasmus Mundus), civic society or respect for human rights. The Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol represents another milestone in mutual relations, and I believe that this is an important step in deepening cooperation in the field of home affairs and criminal affairs, which is more than desirable given its immediate geographical proximity. The agreement itself addresses in particular the process of exchanging information on expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, as well as advice and support on individual issues. cases of criminal investigation. The exchange of information will enable both parties to fight organized crime and terrorism, but also to develop other possibilities for cooperation, such as training and crime prevention activities. The conclusion of this cooperation agreement is a very concrete step towards making Ukraine a key partner in the fight against organized crime.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the agreement because it would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime, which is international by definition, and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other relevant criminal matters. This agreement concerns the proposed approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, providing for the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information could be in the field of specialist knowledge, general situation reports, and results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, and information on crime-prevention methods, participation in training activities as well as providing advice and support in individual criminal investigations.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: in writing. - The Council prepared a draft decision approving the conclusion by Europol of an agreement between Ukraine and the European Police Office (Europol) on operational and strategic cooperation, including the exchange of personal data. The Council must consult Parliament before adopting the draft. Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, and the fight against security and crime are fundamental responsibilities in order to fully achieve the objectives of this partnership. According to Europol, Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The report of the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs therefore proposes that Parliament approve the Council's draft. I voted accordingly.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: in writing. - In order to improve efficiency in preventing and combating serious forms of crime, Europol has initiated the procedure for concluding an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation with Ukraine. The terms of cooperation provide for exchanges of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on crime prevention methods. , participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. In addition, the agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data. This is unacceptable. In addition, the conclusion of this agreement is part of the more or less hidden perspective of Ukraine's potential membership of the European Union. We are opposed to this idea.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: in writing.- This agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data, which is unacceptable.In addition, the conclusion of this agreement is part of the more or less hidden perspective of Ukraine's potential accession to the European Union, which I am opposed.I am therefore voting against this agreement.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.Its objective is to support the action of the authorities of the Member States in the prevention of organized crime, terrorism and other serious forms of crime.At a time when crime is increasingly cross-border, it is essential to strengthen cooperation between judicial authorities within the European Union.

name: József NAGY
text: in writing.- The mission of the European Police Office is to assist Member States in preventing and combating all forms of serious international crime and terrorism.Along with threats and threats, Europol's role has grown in recent years.I am pleased that the operational, strategic and technical agreement works with many countries across the borders of the European Union.Ukraine will soon be able to join these key allies.I would like to emphasize that the European Parliament pays particular attention to the adequate protection of personal data and that Ukraine fulfills all the conditions in this area.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ The establishment of Europol was agreed through the Maastricht Treaty in 1992. Europol has its headquarters in The Hague, The Netherlands, and assists the 28 Member States of the European Union in their fight against international crime and terrorism. I have voted for this report that will provide approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, providing for the exchange of information, including personal data.

name: Dan NICA
text: signed up. - This proposal concerns the approval of an Operational and Strategic Agreement between Europol and Ukraine which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data. This information could be in the field of expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in certain criminal investigations. Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are imperative for achieving the goals of this partnership. The exchange of information will enable the EU, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively. In addition to the exchange of information, the agreement also offers other opportunities, such as training and crime prevention activities. The conclusion of this cooperation agreement is a very concrete and powerful step that Ukraine is taking to become a key partner in the fight against organized crime.

name: Norica NICOLAI
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of this report, given that Ukraine is and chooses to act as a key partner of the European Union in the cooperation established by the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are two of the most important actions to continuethis partnership.The report adopted today endorses the strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, which intensifies the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information in order to prevent and combat crime, trafficking in human beings and other major crimes, such as terrorism.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: written.- I abstained from voting on this report as the exchange of personal data is not excluded.Because of this, I cannot speak in favor of this report.

name: Urmas PAET
text: in writing.- I supported.Ukraine is an important partner of the EU and cooperation with Ukraine is important in the fight against drugs, trafficking in human beings and organized crime groups.The agreement provides an opportunity for better information exchange and crime prevention, as well as a broader framework for combating transnational crime.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: in writing. - I support the report. In particular, there is a need to support and strengthen the action of the competent authorities of the Member States and their cooperation in the field of organized crime, terrorism and other serious crimes. Given that Ukraine is a key partner of the EU under the Eastern Partnership, and in order to combat and strengthen the fight against organized crime more effectively, closer operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol through the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information needs to be encouraged. It should be noted that this cooperation agreement also covers the exchange of personal data. It should be noted that this agreement will make it possible to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of transnational crime more effectively. In addition, it will increase international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other related criminal law, as well as the effectiveness of prevention and the fight against them.

name: Demetris PAPADAKIS
text: in writing. - Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are a key imperative in order to fully achieve the objectives of this partnership. Ukraine is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organized crime, in particular drug and economic crime, human trafficking and trafficking, as well as mobile (itinerant) organized crime groups. The exchange of information will enable the European Union, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime. I voted in favor of the report on the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, as this agreement will create training opportunities and activities in the field of crime prevention and will strengthen international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings. and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of my colleagues' proposal as I believe that the conclusion of an agreement between Europol and Ukraine for a mutual exchange of information is suitable in order to facilitate the country's entry between EU Member States, also considering thatUkraine is a key partner in the fight against organized crime.I therefore voted in favor.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: written. - I support the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and EUROPOL because I believe that coordinated and guided cooperation is a key way to successfully address a number of security challenges facing Ukraine, but also the European Union as a whole. Areas where quality co-operation needs to be established are international organized crime, terrorism, human trafficking, migrant smuggling and drug trafficking. Taking into account the current security environment of the European Union, it is clear that the establishment of quality cooperation is of common interest in order to create a quality framework for the fight against international crime. It is essential that Member States, through the action of EUROPOL, succeed in preventing, detecting, combating and investigating serious forms of international crime in the aforementioned areas. The exchange of strategic and technical information is important for the analysis of various threats and risks with the aim of creating prevention strategies and methods for managing various crises. Joint observation and monitoring and analysis of the results obtained can help to more successfully implement existing and future legislative arrangements and solutions and related techniques and tools. On the other hand, it is important to ensure that data exchange is conducted through secure channels, using the highest standards of protection of secrecy and privacy and mechanisms to combat data theft.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: in writing.- The terms of cooperation governed by the operational and strategic agreement provide for the exchange of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures andinformation on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.In addition, the agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data.This is unacceptable.In addition, the conclusion of this agreement is part of the more or less covert view of Ukraine's potential accession to the European Union.Firmly opposed to this prospect, I therefore vote against this text.

name: Tonino PICULA
