text: written. - I strongly support the conclusion of an agreement on strategic and operational cooperation with Ukraine, as it would support and strengthen the fight against organized crime, which is by definition international, and would contribute to improving international cooperation in the field of human trafficking and other relevant criminal issues. There are clear operational needs to deepen Europol's operational cooperation with Ukraine. Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union within the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are important priorities for the full achievement of the partnership's goals. The exchange of information will enable the EU, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively. In addition to exchanging information, the agreement also opens up opportunities such as training and crime prevention activities. The conclusion of this cooperation agreement represents a very concrete and powerful step for Ukraine to become a key partner in the fight against organized crime. The signing of this agreement will encourage further harmonization of strategies and action plans in various areas of crime in the EU and its Member States, on the one hand, and in Ukraine, on the other.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing. - This report proposes the approval of a strategic cooperation agreement between EUROPOL and Ukraine. The information exchanged may include specific knowledge, reports on the general situation, results of the strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, training activities, and the provision of advice and support in criminal investigations. individual. EUROPOL is a structure that imposes the path of Federalization. Since its creation, the EU has given it powers that undermine the sovereignty of States, by overlapping with national police and developing its activity beyond the reach and democratic control, as opposed to cooperation policies between and between States, within the framework sovereignty and its own internal and external security structures. Reasons that would justify a vote against. But in addition to the geopolitical framework of Ukraine, the privileged stage that has been to justify the confrontation with and encirclement of the Russian Federation, and the sponsorship of the EU and the USA of an ultra-nationalist and fascist regime in Ukraine.

name: Miroslav POCHE
text: in writing.- I consider security to be one of the EU's main tasks.Ukraine is an important partner for the EU in the field of security and the fight against crime.If EUROPOL cooperates effectively with other countries outside the EU, its ability to prevent criminal activities on our territory will increase.I believe that cooperation with Ukraine will increase the chances of detecting drug and economic crime, human trafficking and smuggling, and should also focus on the fight against mobile (nomadic) criminal groups.It is important that both parties coordinate their strategies and action plans.This mutually beneficial agreement will be based primarily on information sharing, which will enable the Member States and Ukraine to prevent organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. - The current project concerns the proposal to approve the conclusion of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol. The terms of cooperation include the exchange of information which may include specialist knowledge, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods and participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support for individual criminal investigations. I believe that there is a clear need for Europol to deepen operational cooperation with Ukraine as a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership. I strongly support the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Ukraine, as it would help and strengthen the fight against organized crime and help improve international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other important criminal matters. I voted in favor of this report.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: in writing.- I support EU-Ukraine cooperation in a number of areas.For this reason, I also consider the cooperation that we are approving today to be necessary.In addition, I consider security cooperation to be very important.

name: Franck PROUST
text: in writing.- I spoke in favor of this agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.The exchange of information will enable EU Member States and Ukraine to prevent organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime.The fight against these phenomena is a constant struggle.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. - This report concerns the proposed approval of an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Ukraine. It provides for the exchange of information, including personal data, as well as enabling training actions and crime prevention activities. Ukraine is currently a key partner of the European Union, so security and the fight against crime are particularly relevant in the context of this partnership. The exchange of information will enable the Union, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat terrorism and other forms of international crime, including organized crime, more effectively. The signing of the operational and strategic cooperation agreement should encourage greater coordination between action plans in the various areas of crime in the EU and its Member States, on the one hand, and Ukraine, on the other. Because the conclusion of this cooperation agreement is a very concrete and important step in enhancing the partnership between the Union and Ukraine, I voted in favor.

name: Julia REID
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP MEPs have voted against this technically non-legislative consultation. UKIP do not support the legitimacy of Europol as an institution and do not support the EU concluding agreements with third countries.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing.- Mr President, this agreement with Ukraine represents another step in the fight against organized crime, more specifically in terms of economic and drug-related crime, human trafficking and smuggling.The exchange of information with Europol will enable the European Union, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: written. - I voted in favor of this report establishing an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol. The report provides for an exchange of information to help Europol further deepen its cooperation with Ukraine. Ukraine is a key partner of the Union and increasingly relevant in the fight against organized crime, specifically in terms of drug-related crimes, trafficking in human beings, smuggling and organized crime gangs. The exchange of information with Ukraine will enable the Union to combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively. In addition, the Agreement also expands opportunities for cooperation in areas such as fighting training activities and crime prevention. The signing of this Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement should foster greater coordination between the various strategies and action plans of the Union, its Member States and Ukraine.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.The objective of this agreement is to support the action of the competent authorities with a view to preventing and combating organized crime, terrorism and other serious forms of crime.This operational and strategic agreement provides for the exchange of information concerning, in particular, methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, etc.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: in writing.- Judicial cooperation with third countries is a key part of the EU's practical external relations agenda.It is by expanding such cooperation that we encourage the development of the principles of good governance and ensure that criminals and suspects cannot hide from justice.I am convinced that this agreement with Ukraine, our partner, which has suffered greatly because of its European aspirations, will be an important step in promoting the development of an area of good governance east of the European Union's borders.At the same time, I would even like to express my surprise and remark to the Commission, why have such agreements not been concluded much earlier?

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: written.- The proposal refers to the approval of the conclusion of an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.And although, according to Europol, Ukraine occupies an increasingly important place in the fight against organized crime, it is still a country with a conflictive relationship with human rights;criterion that my group takes into account when approving any Cooperation Agreement.On the other hand, the European Parliament has voted a new Regulation for Europol that will enter into force next year, in which the Cooperation Agreements will be established through a much more transparent procedure than the current one.There are not enough reasons to hastily approve an Agreement with a country for which we do not have sufficient democratic and legal guarantees.I have voted against.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: written. - I have voted against this Agreement for two key reasons. The first is that I understand that the Europol Agency does not act with the transparency and guarantees that an institution of this type requires. In particular, in agreements with third countries, there are no minimums in terms of data protection and judicial guarantees, in addition to not being clear as to the powers of the different bodies and the rights to which an investigated person or stopped. On the other hand, the occurrence of this type of Agreement with Ukraine is not accidental, and obeys the strategy of stressing the relationship between the Union and Russia, to which I oppose, in addition to being Ukraine a country with institutions taken over by far right since the coup in 2014, there has been a substantial deterioration in human rights conditions. For both reasons, I have voted against an opaque police agreement without guarantees and, furthermore, with a State with so few democratic guarantees.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. - With today's vote, the European Parliament approved the conclusion of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and the European Police Office (Europol). This agreement is of prime importance in strengthening the fight against organized crime, in particular that related to drugs and economic crime, trafficking in human beings and smuggling, as well as in the fight against mobile organized crime groups. In the framework of the Eastern Partnership, Ukraine is a key partner in achieving the basic objectives of this partnership, such as security and the fight against crime. There is therefore a clear operational need for Europol to cooperate with Ukraine. The key to the success of the fight against organized crime lies in the exchange of information and expertise concerning criminal groups at EU level and with the countries concerned such as Ukraine in this case. Europol can play a decisive role in this context in supporting and strengthening the action of the competent authorities of the Member States and mutual cooperation. I therefore voted in favor of concluding this agreement.

name: Jill SEYMOUR
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this as I do not wish for the EU to make agreements on our behalf.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: in writing. - I support this motion for a resolution on the proposed approval of the operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which governs the exchange of information, including personal data.Europol clearly needs to deepen its operational cooperation with Ukraine.Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are essential requirements in order to fully achieve the objectives of this partnership.I therefore voted in favor.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report, but this explanation of vote arises as a critique of the current system of evaluating the work of MPs in the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities emphasized in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual qualityactions.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing - I supported the conclusion of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol. I agree that if we want to deepen relations with our most important neighbor of the Eastern Partnership, enhanced security cooperation is its cornerstone. Cooperation between the authorities of Europol and Ukraine will consist in particular in the exchange of key information, which may be of an operational, strategic, technical or even classified nature. In particular, this exchange may concern expertise, general situation reports, the results of strategic analyzes, or information on criminal investigation procedures. According to the information available to the European Parliament, Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime. Europol is convinced that Ukraine will be an important partner for the EU in the fight against specific crimes, such as drug trafficking, economic crime, trafficking in human beings and smuggling. I therefore welcome Europol's efforts to involve the Ukrainian authorities in the fight against international crime, and I hope that this agreement will also bring Ukraine closer to the European position.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: in writing. - EUROPOL assists Member States in the fight against organized crime within the EU. Unfortunately, the dimensions of organized crime do not end at the EU's borders, so cooperation with third countries and international organizations is essential for more effective action. The Group of the Greens / EES supports cross-border cooperation between countries in the fight against crime. The agreement focuses on Ukraine, a country close to the EU's borders and also a potential candidate for EU membership. Therefore, in-depth cooperation with Ukraine in order to prevent all forms of crime and terrorism is important and necessary. I believe that this can have a positive impact on the situation and the situation in the country, and it can also contribute to better integration of Ukraine with the EU. It is also positive that strategic agreements include the exchange of information but exclude personal data. In addition, activities may be carried out by EUROPOL only after this has been approved by the European Council, after prior consultation with EUROPOL representatives. From a broader geopolitical perspective, improving cooperation between the EU and Ukraine would deepen the political dialogue between the two sides and, consequently, have a positive impact on further integration in the areas of human rights, the rule of law and fundamental human rights. That is why I voted in favor of the report.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: in writing - Europe must work with partner countries to fight organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime.Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against criminal activity.The exchange of information and personal data is key in this.

name: Jaromír ŠTĚTINA
text: in writing. - I was very pleased to support the conclusion of a strategic and operational cooperation agreement between Ukraine and Europol. Thanks to the agreement, the EU, the Member States and Ukraine will be able to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime much more effectively. Cooperation in the future will ensure the exchange of expertise, strategic analysis, sharing information on investigative procedures or prevention methods. Thanks to the partnership, support will also be provided in the investigation of specific criminal cases. The operational nature of the agreement will allow both partners to share personal data, the exchange of which significantly increases the success rate of mutual cooperation. I would like to remind you that the conclusion of the agreement between Ukraine and Europol is also the fulfillment of one of the many conditions for visa liberalization between the EU and Ukraine. Ukraine has met its commitments. I hope that the vote on visa liberalization will take place very soon. As the shadow rapporteur for the successfully agreed cooperation agreement between Ukraine and Eurojust, I would like to reiterate the importance of EU cooperation with Ukraine. A closer partnership on security is another strong signal of the gradual rapprochement between the two parties in many other areas as well.

name: Beatrix von STORCH
text: written. - I did not agree to the resolution of the EU Parliament on the draft implementing decision of the Council on the approval by the European Police Office (Europol) of the conclusion of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol. This proposal concerns the proposed approval of an agreement between Europol and Ukraine on operational and strategic cooperation involving the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information could include specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigations and methods of crime prevention, participation in training and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. Europol now has a wide range of powers, including Internet surveillance through its own task force that monitors the Internet both inside and outside the EU. The motto is “Fighting cybercrime around the world”. I am opposed to anything that gives Europol further powers and further data access. A good idea, that of cooperation between Member States on cross-border crime, has been overstretched here.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: written.- There are clear operational needs to deepen Europol's cooperation with Ukraine in the fight against organized crime.The exchange of information between Europol and the Ukrainian authorities will make it possible to prevent international crime and terrorism more effectively.The agreement also opens up opportunities such as training and crime prevention activities, which would be a strong step for Ukraine to become a key EU partner in the fight against organized crime.The Europol Joint Supervisory Body gave a positive opinion on the conclusion of this cooperation agreement, taking into account the level of data protection in Ukraine.I support this report because Europol's cooperation with Ukraine would strengthen the fight against organized crime, and the agreement would also help continue the rapprochement between the EU and Ukraine.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by Europol of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and the European Police Office (Europol).I support the conclusion of an agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which will strengthen operational and strategic cooperation in the field of information exchange.This ranges from expertise and general status reports to methods of crime prevention and participation in training activities and counseling and support in individual criminal investigations.

name: Pavel SVOBODA
text: in writing.- Today, I supported the European Parliament's assent to the proposal for a Council decision approving the conclusion of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Ukraine and Europol, as I believe that there is a real need for closer cooperation between EU and Ukrainian police forces, especially inthe fight against organized crime (drug, economic crime) or terrorism.I also consider the conclusion of this agreement to be an important element in EU-Ukraine relations, especially in view of the positive developments so far towards the introduction of a visa-free regime between the EU and Ukraine.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: in writing. - The report concerns the proposed adoption of an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which provides for the exchange of information containing personal data. This information may include specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on crime investigation procedures and methods of prevention, participation in training activities, as well as advice and support in specific criminal investigations. We disagree on both the substance and the procedural issues. In essence, we reject such agreements with third countries, especially when there are no high standards of human rights protection. The agreement could also be seen as a reinforcing tool to put pressure on Russia. It is also worth noting that the European Parliament has voted on the new Europol Regulation, which will enter into force next year, on the basis of which such agreements will be discussed more transparently. So the haste of the Council and Europol to promote these agreements under the old regime worries us. For these reasons, we voted against the report.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: in writing.- The act demonstrates that commitments in the field of information exchange are subject to either personal will or national security accreditations, with the recent example of the bombers of the terrorist attacks in Paris and Brussels, where Member States' secret services did not inform each other.The agreement neither really strengthens the risk-based approach, nor does it guarantee the obligation of data protection by design and default.

name: József SZÁJER
text: in writing. - The exchange of information with law enforcement agencies of third country partners is crucial for the successful fight against transnational organized crime. According to the European Police Office (Europol), Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime and more specific crimes related to drugs or the economy, as well as trafficking and smuggling of human beings and mobile (migrant) organized crime groups. The agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Ukraine will allow for the necessary exchange of information and the organization of crime prevention activities and training. Europol clearly needs to deepen its cooperation with Ukraine, which is why, as a member of the Fidesz-KDNP People's Party delegation, I voted in favor of the initiative.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the European Parliament giving its consent to the Council's draft agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between the Ukrainian authorities and Europol. Ukraine is a key partner of the EU in the framework of close cooperation under the Eastern Partnership and, in part, the DCFTA, which cannot be complete without exploiting the potential of cross-border law enforcement, in particular the long common border between the two parties. As Vice-Chair of the EP Delegation to Ukraine to oversee the implementation of the Association Agreement, I am regularly confronted with the significant efforts being made by the Ukrainian government and authorities to move closer to the EU legal order. I am convinced that the opportunities for cooperation between law enforcement and judicial authorities opened up by the agreement now envisaged between Europol and Ukraine will substantially and directly serve the security of European citizens, in particular more effective action against organized crime, including trafficking in goods, drugs and human beings. through. I believe that the visa facilitation to be introduced by the EU for Ukrainian citizens in the near future will make it particularly important to work more closely with the Ukrainian authorities.

name: Claudia ȚAPARDEL
text: signed up. - The European Union has set itself the goal in recent years of combating and eradicating negative phenomena such as terrorism, cross-border organized crime, arms, human and drug trafficking, as well as other illegal activities. Achieving this goal is the task of Europol, the Union's specialized agency, whose role has grown significantly in recent times. In order to carry out its activities as efficiently as possible, Europol has concluded a series of operational and strategic cooperation agreements with certain countries with which the Union has privileged relations, agreements to facilitate cooperation between the specialized institutions of both parties, including the exchange of personal data. achieving the common goal. Ukraine is a key EU partner in the Eastern Partnership, which has signed an association and stabilization partnership with the Union and has made significant progress in adopting European legislation in all areas. The signing of the Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and Ukraine is a step towards strengthening cooperation between the two parties, which will also have a positive influence on facilitating the mobility of European and Ukrainian citizens. I believe that this is a welcome agreement, the adoption of which will help strengthen the strategic relationship between the EU and Ukraine.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: in writing. - I voted for the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Ukraine, because it would facilitate and intensify the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which by definition has an international character, in addition to helping to strengthen international cooperation in the fight against trafficking in human beings and other relevant criminal matters. According to Europol, Ukraine is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime, in particular against drug-related and economic crime, against trafficking in human beings and smuggling networks, as well as against itinerant organized criminal groups. The exchange of information will allow the Union, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime and to combat them more effectively. In addition to the exchange of information, the agreement provides for the possibility of carrying out training and crime prevention actions.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ The proposal for an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol outlines the mutual benefits of such an agreement, which would see the intensification of cooperation against organised crime, terrorism, as well as other forms of crime affecting both EU Member States and Ukraine. The proposal aims to accomplish this through the exchange of operational, strategic and technical information, including personal data and classified information. More than ever, we need to work together to combat transnational and digital crime, and this can only be done through intensive cooperation between the EU and third countries. For these reasons, I voted in favour of the proposal.

name: Ivica TOLIĆ
text: written.- I support the "Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Ukraine and Europol".There are clear operational needs to deepen Europol's operational cooperation with Ukraine.Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union within the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are important priorities for the full achievement of the partnership's goals.According to Europol, Ukraine is increasingly important in the fight against organized crime and more specific drug-related crimes, economic crime, human trafficking and smuggling of goods, as well as against organized crime groups.The exchange of information will enable the EU, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and combat organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: written. - This proposal concerns the proposed authorization to conclude an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which will allow the exchange of information which may include expertise, general status reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on prevention methods. crime, participation in training activities and providing advice and support in individual criminal investigations. Ukraine is a key ally of the European Union within the Eastern Partnership, and accordingly is an increasingly important partner in the fight against organized crime, drug trafficking, economic crime, human trafficking and trafficking in goods. Therefore, this exchange of information will enable the EU, the Member States and Ukraine to prevent and fight organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively. In times of urgency, such cooperation will provide additional and enhanced security and protection for all citizens of EU Member States. So I voted in favor.

name: Romana TOMC
text: in writing. - I supported the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and the European Police Office. In accordance with Article 23 (2) of the current Council Decision on Europol (Decision 2009/371 / JHA), agreements on international cooperation with third countries or international organizations may be concluded only after approval by the Council, after consulting the European Parliament. The proposal concerns the proposed approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data. According to Europol, Ukraine is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organized crime, especially those related to drugs and the economy, trafficking in human beings and smuggling, and mobile (traveling) organized crime groups. By exchanging information, the EU, Member States and Ukraine will be able to prevent organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime more effectively.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: written.- The proposal refers to the approval of the conclusion of an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.And although, according to Europol, Ukraine occupies an increasingly important place in the fight against organized crime, it is still a country with a conflictive relationship with human rights;criterion that my group takes into account when approving any Cooperation Agreement.On the other hand, the European Parliament has voted on a new Regulation for Europol that will enter into force next year, in which the Cooperation Agreements will be established through a much more transparent procedure than the current one.There are not enough reasons to hastily approve an Agreement with a country for which we do not have sufficient democratic and legal guarantees.I have voted against.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: in writing. - In order to improve efficiency in preventing and combating serious forms of crime, Europol has initiated the procedure for concluding an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation with Ukraine. The terms of cooperation governed by the operational and strategic agreement provide for exchanges of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information. on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. In addition, the agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data. This is unacceptable. In addition, the conclusion of this agreement is part of the more or less hidden perspective of Ukraine's potential membership of the European Union. So I logically voted against.

name: Kazimierz Michał UJAZDOWSKI
text: in writing.- There are operational needs for Europol to deepen operational cooperation with Ukraine.Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union within the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are one of the basic goals of cooperation and strategic reforms in Ukraine.That is why I voted in favor of the agreement

name: István UJHELYI
text: in writing.- The current Council Decision on Europol requires the Council, after consulting the European Parliament, to approve the conclusion of international cooperation agreements with third countries or international organizations.Such an agreement may cover the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information.The operational cooperation agreement also covers the exchange of personal data.I supported it with my vote.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: written.- The proposal refers to the approval of the conclusion of an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.And although, according to Europol, Ukraine occupies an increasingly important place in the fight against organized crime, it is still a country with a conflictive relationship with human rights;criterion that my group takes into account when approving any Cooperation Agreement.On the other hand, the European Parliament has voted on a new Regulation for Europol that will enter into force next year, in which the Cooperation Agreements will be established through a much more transparent procedure than the current one.There are not enough reasons to hastily approve an Agreement with a country for which we do not have sufficient democratic and legal guarantees.I have voted against.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I abstained from voting on the Report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Ukraine and Europol. The Report states that there is clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its operational cooperation with Ukraine. Beyond the exchange of information, the agreement also opens opportunities such as training and crime prevention activities. I abstained from voting because I believe that the Report contains too many elements that relate to third countries in the immediate neighbourhood.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: written.- This proposal refers to the approval of an Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Ukraine and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information.As this country is a key partner of the Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, cooperation with it should be strengthened, as security and the fight against crime are underlying imperatives in order to fully achieve the objectives of the Eastern Partnership.This Agreement will support and strengthen the fight against organized crime - which, by definition, is international - and will help to intensify international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other relevant criminal matters.Knowing that Ukraine occupies an increasingly important place in the fight against organized crime, I have decided to vote in favor of this text.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: written. - I have voted against this Agreement for two key reasons. The first is that I understand that the Europol Agency does not act with the transparency and guarantees that an institution of this type requires. In particular, in agreements with third countries, there are no minimums in terms of data protection and judicial guarantees, in addition to not being clear as to the powers of the different bodies and the rights to which an investigated person or stopped. On the other hand, the occurrence of this type of Agreement with Ukraine is not accidental, and obeys the strategy of stressing the relationship between the Union and Russia, to which I oppose, in addition to being Ukraine a country with institutions taken over by far right since the coup in 2014, there has been a substantial deterioration in human rights conditions. For both reasons, I have voted against an opaque police agreement without guarantees and, furthermore, with a State with so few democratic guarantees.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: written.- I voted in favor because there is a clear operational need within Europol for increased cooperation with Ukraine.Ukraine is an important partner of the EU under the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are fundamental prerequisites for achieving the objectives of this partnership.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing.- Europol is a structure that imposes the path of Federalization.Since its creation, the EU has given it competences that undermine the sovereignty of States, developing its activity beyond the reach and democratic control.We understand that Europol should not override national police and their activities.We therefore advocate cooperation between the internal and external security structures of the various countries.And because this proposal arises in the context of the renewed European Union's relations with Russia, the intimidating advance of NATO forces across its borders, and the existence of one of the ultranationalist and fascist regime in Ukraine promoted by the USA, EU and NATO,we voted against.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: written.- The proposal includes strategic and operational cooperation and thus also an increased exchange of information between Europol and Ukraine.On the one hand, such an agreement would be desirable, but on the other hand, since this agreement does not exclude the exchange of personal data and I am critical of the centralized Europeanization of police work with Europol, I have abstained.

name: Daniele VIOTTI
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and Europol.In practice, we need Europol to deepen operational cooperation with Ukraine, which plays the role of an important partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are imperative in achieving this goal..

name: Iuliu WINKLER
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of the report on the agreement between Europol and Ukraine.The Council proposal concerns the approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Ukraine which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.There are clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its operational cooperation with Ukraine.Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are underlying imperatives to achieve the objectives of this partnership.

name: Tomáš ZDECHOVSKÝ
text: in writing.- Personally, I consider Europol to be one of the most important for ensuring security in Europe.In today's interconnected Europe, it is not possible for the transfer of data on dangerous or potentially dangerous persons not to work.That is why I fully support this agreement, as cooperation with Ukraine will give Europol a more comprehensive and full-fledged picture of crime in Europe, which will enable it to identify and assess immediate threats and longer-term trends in all areas of crime more quickly.Better cooperation between the police forces of Ukraine and Europol should also lead to the production of better quality intelligence documents, which will make it possible to protect the security of European citizens more effectively and to combat terrorism more effectively.

name: Jana ŽITŇANSKÁ
text: in writing - I supported the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Europol and Ukraine.The agreement concerns a more efficient exchange of information, including personal data, and an overall deepening of cooperation between Europol and Ukraine.As Ukraine is a key partner of the European Union in the framework of the Eastern Partnership, I think that the new agreement will help to improve the security situation and the fight against crime.I believe that the agreement, and in particular Ukraine's valuable experience in the fight against crime, will be beneficial in the current volatile security situation.

name: Milan ZVER
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by Europol of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Ukraine and the European Police Office (Europol).According to Europol, Ukraine is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organized crime, especially in relation to drugs and the economy, trafficking in human beings and smuggling, and mobile (traveling) organized crime groups.I therefore support the conclusion of this Agreement on Strategic and Operational Cooperation with Ukraine, as I believe that it will help to fight organized crime and contribute to strengthening international cooperation in the field of trafficking in human beings and other major crimes.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing.- The following dossier concerns the waiver of the immunity of the French deputy Jean-François Jalkh, accused by the association "Maison des potes - maison de l'egalitè" of public incitement to discrimination on grounds of nationality, racial or religious origin.The accusation was made following some statements that Jean-François Jalkh made in a pamphlet entitled "Handbook for local councilors of the Front National".Since I believe it is unfair and unacceptable to make statements involving any kind of discrimination, I have decided to vote in favor of waiving the immunity of the French Member.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of the parliamentary immunity of François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France for his discriminatory and racist statements.The aforementioned statements do not have to do with his parliamentary work, they are nothing but an expression of his deplorable far-right position.I have therefore voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his incitement to racism and hatred.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. – In this case Mr Jalkh, previously the publications director and online editor for Front National, was responsible for the publication and dissemination of a handbook inciting discrimination. The Handbook in question contained guides for Front National local councillors about the need to give priority to French people, for instance in the allocation of social housing. As Mr Jalkh was not an MEP at the time of publication, and the actions are in no way connected to his role as an MEP now, I voted for the waiver.

name: Eric ANDRIEU
text: in writing.- I voted for the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing. - The request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity of the deputy JF Jalkh is justified only on partisan grounds, for the following reasons: the fact that the present request for waiver of the immunity of Mr. Jalkh was signed on the same day (14 April 2016) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian when these cases relate to events occurring at different times; the fact that it is claimed that the present request for waiver of immunity follows a judicial investigation opened to the prosecution of the Nanterre tribunal de grande instance against Mr. Jalkh, which is false, since it is 'was a complaint against X; the fact that the present request relates to an element of the program of the National Front which has never been challenged by the courts in its 44 years of existence: national preference. I therefore voted against this request for the waiver of immunity, which is a gross partisan maneuver.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ Requests for immunity waivers are not the subject of roll-call votes. In the interests of democracy and transparency I would therefore like to confirm that I voted to waive the immunity. My reason for this is straightforward, and completely unconnected to the circumstances of the case or any allegations: immunity does not cover events which occurred before the start of an MEP’s mandate.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing.- The Prosecutor General of the Court of Appeal of Versailles had requested the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho MEP.The waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho relates to allegations of public, racial or religious discrimination in public, in writing, through the use of images or electronic media against an unnamed person.As the allegations are manifestly unrelated to Jean-François Jalkho's duties as a Member of the European Parliament, he decides to waive Jean-François Jalkho's immunity.

name: Zoltán BALCZÓ
text: in writing. - The request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh relates to an alleged offense of public incitement to national, racial or religious discrimination by electronic means. The complaint concerns statements in the 'Front National Handbook for Local Government Representatives' brochure, published by Jean-François Jalkh as the responsible publisher, which were used to encourage Front National local government representatives to be elected in the elections of 23 and 30 March 2014. relate to the fact that at the first meeting of the new municipal councils, during the allocation of social housing, it is proposed that priority be given to the French people (“national priority”). The previous proposal can, of course, be disagreed with, emphatically rejected, but the wording is considered to be incitement to racial discrimination is, in my view, incorrect, and the committee responsible should have proposed that immunity be upheld in order to ensure the smooth running of the Member. I voted against the proposal to the contrary.

name: Gerard BATTEN
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- Fumus persecutionis.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- In accordance with the recommendation of the Committee on Legal Affairs, I voted in favor of Mr Jalkh's immunity.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing.- Following the recommendations of the Legal Affairs Committee, I voted in favor of the request for waiver of immunity for Mr Jean-François Jalkh.The Honorable Member was accused by the association "Maison des potes - Maison de l'égalité" for the alleged crime of public incitement to discrimination on grounds of nationality, racial or religion in relation to statements made in a brochure entitled "Manual forthe local councilors of the Front National ", published on 19 September 2013 and posted on the official website of the Front National federation on 30 November 2013. The Commission verified that there was no connection between the controversial statements and the parliamentary functions of Jean-François Jalkh and not suspecting the presence of fumus persecutionis decided to waive his immunity.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report and therefore to waive the parliamentary immunity of Mr Jalkh.It will be the relevant courts in your country that decide whether or not you have committed a crime, but it is our job to suspend immunity so that the fact can be tried.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing. - This request for the waiver of immunity is part of a lawsuit by the public prosecutor of Nanterre against Jean-François Jalkh as director of publication of the frontnational.com site. A short practical guide for candidates and FN representatives had been published on the website of the FN 66 federation, recommending FN advisers to ask for national preference in municipal councils. This guide was also available in paper version. For me, this request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity does indeed amount to a fumus persecutionis for several reasons, in particular the fact that the present request for waiver of the immunity of Mr. Jalkh was signed on the same day (April 14, 2016 ) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian whereas these cases relate to facts which occurred at different times, but also the fact that it is affirmed that the present request for waiver of immunity follows a judicial investigation opened to the prosecution of the Nanterre tribunal de grande instance against Mr. Jalkh, which is false, since it was a complaint against X and other reasons. So I naturally voted against and supported my colleague.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- I took part in the vote on the Chrysogonos report.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written. - I voted in favor of suspending the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, in view of the report prepared by the Legal Affairs Committee, which states that the prosecutor of the Versailles Court of Appeal has requested such suspension in relation to an alleged crime of incitement to national, racial or religious discrimination after the complaint filed against him for the statements made in a pamphlet entitled Petit guide pratique de l'élu municipal Front National (Practical guide to the elected position of the National Front), published on September 19 2013 and published on the official website of the National Front federation on November 30, 2013, which encouraged the National Front candidates elected councilors in the elections held on March 23 and 30, 2014 to recommend, from the first plenary session of the new City Councils, the defense of the "national priority" in matters of attribution of social housing, being Jean-François Jalkh director of publications of the National Front. Since Jean-François Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament at the time the alleged crime was committed and since the charges are manifestly unrelated to his status as a Member of the European Parliament, I have decided to vote in favor.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report because it decided to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho from France. This waiver of immunity relates to a pre-trial investigation against Jean-François Jalkh in the Nanterre Regional Court following a complaint from the Maisons des Potes - Maison de l'Égalité alleging civil incitement to racial or religious discrimination. The complaint refers to the year 2013. September 19 In the brochure “Memory of a member of the National Front elected to the municipal council” published in 2013, which was published in 2013. November 30 appeared on the official website of the National Front Federation, words were added to encourage future members of the City Council from the National Front to be elected in 2014. March 23 and 30 d. from the first meeting of the new members of the city council, to recommend defending the "national priority" in the issue of social housing. Jean-François Jalkh was then Director of Publications for the National Front and Director of Publications for all Federation websites. Jean-François Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament when the act was committed, and the allegations are clearly unrelated to Jean-François Jalkh's duties as a Member of the European Parliament, but are in fact limited to national or regional activities, as the words were addressed to candidates. to the members of the city council who intended to participate in 2014. March 23-24 local elections.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: in writing.- I agree with the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh, because, having regard to the request made by the French Minister for Justice and Civil Liberties concerning the judicial inquiry ordered by the Nanterre District Court following a request from the Maison des potes- Maison de l'égalité for the consolidation of legal proceedings concerning the public promotion of racial or religious discrimination.I personally consider such public incitement to racial or religious discrimination to be extremely inappropriate and unworthy of a person in such a position.

name: Biljana BORZAN
text: written.- I support this Report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing. - This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity is indeed a fumus persecutionis. It should be noted first that after more than two years of investigation, the courts still claim to ignore that Jean-François Jalkh is not director of the publication of the National Front of the Eastern Pyrenees website. In addition, it is essential to recall that this present request for waiver of immunity was signed on the same day (April 14, 2016) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian when they relate to facts that have occurred. at different times. Finally, this present request relates to an element of the National Front's program which has never been contested by the courts in the 44 years of existence of this political party, namely the establishment of a national preference in favor of our compatriots in terms of access to work, housing and social benefits. I therefore voted against this scandalous request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: in writing.- We support the request for the waiver of immunity, bearing in mind that there is no suspicion of an attempt to obstruct the parliamentary activity of Jean-François Jalkh in the context of the judicial inquiry, which was launched following a lawsuit filed by the Maison des potes - Maison de l'égalité', before he is elected Member of the European Parliament.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: in writing.- We voted on the request for the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.As this request does not concern procedures relating to its activities in the European Parliament, I believe that we must not stand in the way of justice.That is why I voted in favor.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh and noted no objections.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report because from the analysis of the facts presented by the Attorney General at the Court of Appeal of Versailles it became clear that the commission of the alleged crime, denounced by the association "Maison des potes - Maison de l'egalitè",it did not take place during the exercise of the duties of MEP of Jean-Francois Jalkh and considering that there was no fumus persecutionis against the MEP, there was no reason to maintain immunity.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ I support the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of a Member of the European Parliament, Jean-François Jalkh, in connection with a legal action concerning an alleged offence and therefore agree that the report of concerned committee would be communicated immediately to the concerned parties.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of the parliamentary immunity of François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France for his discriminatory and racist statements.The aforementioned statements do not have to do with his parliamentary work, they are nothing but an expression of his deplorable far-right position.I have therefore voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his incitement to racism and hatred.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing.- The parliamentary immunity conferred by Article 8 of the Protocol applies only to the views expressed by Members of the European Parliament in the performance of their duties.I therefore intended to vote in favor of this decision, since there is no direct and obvious link between the disputed statements and the functions of Jean-Francois Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament, these statements, made in the context of a national political debate, are notrelated neither to his work as a Member of the European Parliament nor to the policies of the European Union.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: in writing.- I support the request for the waiver of Jean-François Jalkh's immunity.A criminal case is pending against the MEP in a French court.An MEP has been charged with public incitement to racial or religious hatred through the word.Immunity cannot be a means of avoiding liability, especially if the allegations relate to a period when the person was not a MEP, as was the case here.The alleged acts extend their effects in the MEP's home country.In this respect, it is common ground that immunity limits the possibilities for the French court to enforce the law.The rapporteur recommends lifting immunity, and I think the same.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of waiving the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh as this will give the relevant authorities the opportunity to investigate the case in question and ensure justice is done.

name: William (The Earl of) DARTMOUTH
text: in writing. – UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: in writing.- I voted against this report.This request for waiver of immunity concerns the quality of publication director of Jean-François Jalkh of the site of a National Front federation.In this case, the site encouraged city councilors to call for measures of national preference.On the form, Jean-François Jalkh was indeed director of the publication of the site of the National Front - but not of the sites of its federations.Basically, this is a questioning of a programmatic element, of which the National Front has always been the defender in the 44 years of this party's existence.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: in writing.- I oppose the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.The waiver of immunity should cover only acts falling within the scope of parliamentary duties.In this report, the facts described as accusations have nothing to do with real crimes but only malicious lawsuits by political opponents, in order to damage the MEP's prestige and hinder his work.

name: Rosa ESTARÀS FERRAGUT
text: written.- Under Article 9 of Protocol 7, Members of the European Parliament enjoy, within their national territory, the immunities accorded to the parliamentarians of their Member State.Referring to the French Constitution, article 26 indicates that no member of the French Parliament may be prosecuted, investigated, detained, imprisoned or tried for opinions or votes that he has cast in the exercise of his functions.Considering, firstly, that Jean -François Jalkh was not a European parliamentarian at the time the alleged crime was committed, and, secondly, that no relationship is found between his status as a member of parliament and the charges against him, the Legal Affairs Committee recommends that the European Parliament waive the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: in writing.- Vote against: the request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity is a fumus persecutionis.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - The report deals with the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, submitted in April 2016 by the French Minister for Justice and Freedoms, in the context of the judicial inquiry initiated against this deputy, in the Court of First Instance of Nanterre. The request is related to an alleged offense of public incitement to discrimination based on nationality, race or religion. The complaint concerns statements contained in a booklet entitled “Little practical guide for councilors by the National Front”, published in September 2013 and posted online in November on the website of the National Front federation, which encouraged elected National Front candidates for the post of councilors to recommend, from the first meeting of the new municipal bodies, that French citizens be given priority in the matter of the allocation of social housing. Jean-François Jalkh was the director of publications for the National Front and had editorial control over all of the federation's websites. The person concerned was not a Member of the European Parliament when the alleged crime occurred. The shares in question do not concern opinions or votes expressed by the deputy in the exercise of his functions. There is nothing to suspect the existence of an attempt to obstruct Jean-François Jalkh's parliamentary work.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: in writing.- I oppose the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.The waiver of immunity should cover only acts falling within the scope of parliamentary duties.In this report, the facts described as accusations have nothing to do with real crimes but only malicious lawsuits by political opponents, in order to damage the MEP's prestige and hinder his work.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ The alleged actions do not relate to opinions expressed or votes cast by the Member of the European Parliament in the performance of his duties within the meaning of Article 8 of Protocol No 7 on the Privileges and Immunities of the European Union. I therefore supported the decision to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- I voted in favor of the waiver of immunity from Jean-François Jalkh (Front National).The European Parliament is responding to a request from the French judiciary and paving the way for an appropriate, transparent procedure.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ President, I voted in favour of waiving the immunity of Mr Jalkh.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: in writing.- We voted in favor of lifting the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh MEP of the National Front (France), so that the judicial investigation against him can proceed by the French judiciary for inciting racist attitudes and practices.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour since I have no objections

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh because it is an alleged criminal offense of incitement to discrimination committed before Mr Jalkh was elected to the European Parliament, and because the prosecutionis not linked to the office of Member of the European Parliament.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Konstantínos Chrysogonos on the request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.This procedure is a formality which, without ruling on the merits of the case, aims to enable the judicial authorities to be able to carry out their investigative work.The examination of the case showed that the charges against Mr. Jalkh were unrelated to his parliamentary mandate, allowing the waiver of his immunity.

name: Marek JUREK
text: in writing.- I am strongly opposed to the lifting of the immunity of Mr Jean-François Jalkh as a decision that directly violates the principles of freedom of speech and thought, also recognized as fundamental rights of the European Union.The principle of national preference, that is, the priority of treating citizens of the French Republic in the social policy of French local governments, does not in any way constitute "a public incitement to racial or religious hatred by word, writing, image or electronic public means of communication".The allegations of the "Maisons des potes - Maison de l'égalité" association against Jean-François Jalkh may be the subject of public debate and democratic decisions, and not a basis for judicial repression.If they did occur, they would constitute both a restriction of freedom and (in their consequences) of democracy, and as such they should be the object of condemnation of European opinion.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- I voted to lift Jean-François Jalkh's immunity because the accusation against him is unrelated to the exercise of his mandate.The case which concerns him as editor of the Front National websites is particularly serious, linked to complaints against statements contained in a brochure posted online.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: in writing.- We are here facing a typical case of political persecution.Tainted by several more than doubtful procedural aspects, ignorant of the elements of defense advanced in good faith by Jean-François Jalkh, this request for immunity is shameful, totally dependent and remotely controlled by a French justice worthy of a political police.Obviously, I cannot condone such practices.Like our entire group, therefore, I voted against the request for the waiver of immunity.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of the parliamentary immunity of François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France for his discriminatory and racist statements.The aforementioned statements do not have to do with his parliamentary work, they are nothing but an expression of his deplorable far-right position.I have therefore voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his incitement to racism and hatred.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: written.- The waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh relates to the alleged criminal offense of public incitement to discrimination on the grounds of nationality, race or religion in oral or written form, which is a criminal offense under French law.Whereas the alleged acts do not involve the expression of an opinion or a vote by a Member of the European Parliament in the performance of their duties within the meaning of Article 8 of Protocol No. 1,7 on the privileges and immunities of the European Union, I supported this report.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: in writing - The French authorities requested the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh in connection with an investigation into public incitement to racial and religious discrimination.The request is in accordance with the Rules of Procedure and Protocol No.7 on the privileges and immunities of the European Union, which is why I supported the proposal to waive immunity.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, following the positive recommendation of the Committee on Legal Affairs of the European Parliament.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: in writing.- I voted against Jean-François Jalkh's request for the waiver of immunity.Mr. Jalkh is worried as director of the publication of the site frontnational.com, because of a paper and digital publication of the federation FN 66, prior to his election.This anteriority of the facts and the lack of link between his function of publication director of the national site and the publications of the departmental federations are very questionable.Moreover, in substance, prosecuting an elected official who invites his peers to modify the existing legislation is a serious antidemocratic drift, especially when this is a position defended by the party since its creation.This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity is indeed a fumus persecutionis.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing.- I expressed my opinion against Mr Jalkh's request for waiver of immunity as I believe that parliamentary immunity is not a personal privilege of a Member but a guarantee of the independence of Parliament and its members as an independent institution..I remain convinced that in these cases a guarantee line must be followed and consequently I will continue to vote negatively for this type of relationship in defense of the institutional role conferred by this Parliament.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: in writing.- I support the decision to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho.The French law enforcement authorities must be able to question the Member and find out all the circumstances surrounding the allegations of incitement to racial and religious discrimination.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: in writing.- The report calls for the parliamentary immunity of the far-right MP Jean-François Jalkh to be lifted.Indeed, Jean-François Jalkh is being prosecuted following a complaint from the association "la Maison des potes" for having, in the "Small practical guide for the elected municipal National Front", encouraged to favor the French ("national priority") in access to social housing.The charges are clearly not linked to Jean-François Jalkh's position as MEP since the statements in question were addressed to candidates for the post of municipal councilor in view of the municipal elections of 23 and 30 March 2014I vote for the waiver of immunity.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: in writing. - This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity, concerning Jean-François Jalkh, comes from the public prosecutor of Nanterre who is prosecuting Mr. Jalkh, as director of publication of the frontnational.com site, on the grounds that in a practical guide of the candidate and the elected FN, elected FN officials are asked to claim national preference in municipal councils. This guide has been published on the website of the Front National des Pyrénées-Orientales federation. After two years of investigation, the courts still claim to ignore that Mr. Jalkh is not the publication director of the website of the Pyrénées-Orientales federation, nor of the Front National's paper publications. In addition, this request for the waiver of immunity relates to an element of the Front National's program which has never been challenged judicially since the existence of the Front National. As this request arose out of a certain persecution of members and elected officials of the Front National by the French courts, I therefore opposed it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing.- The defense of the independence of the MEP's mandate falls within the competence of the European Parliament and that independence cannot be called into question.In the present case, the Public Prosecutor of the Versailles Court of Appeal requested the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of a Member of the European Parliament, Jean-François Jalkh, in connection with a lawsuit relating to an alleged crime.The accusations are manifestly unrelated to the post of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament and concern activities of a purely national or regional nature, given that the statements were directed at possible future councilors, with a view to the elections to be heldon March 23 and 30, 2014, and related to his post as director of publications of the National Front with editorial control over all Internet sites of the federation.I vote in favor of waiving parliamentary immunity.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: in writing. - A complaint was lodged against Mr. Jean-François Jalkh on the basis of the statements contained in the FN brochure entitled "Small practical guide to the elected municipal National Front", posted on the official website of the Front federation national on November 30, 2013, in which the FN candidates elected municipal councilors were encouraged to favor the French in access to social housing. The latter is responsible for the comments made in the FN brochure, as director of publications for the National Front and responsible for the editorial control of all the federation's websites. Given that Mr Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament when at the material time, the charges against him are not linked to his current function, as the actions in question do not relate to opinions or votes cast by the Member of the European Parliament in the exercise of his functions within the meaning of Article 8 of Protocol No. 7 on the privileges and immunities of the European Union, I have decided to vote in favor of its lifting of immunity.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the request for the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, because I am in agreement with the decision, forwarded on 14 April 2016 by the French Minister of Justice and Liberties, in connection with a judicial inquiry (file No 14142000183) opened against Mr Jean-François Jalkh at the Nanterre Regional Court in response to an application with joinder filed by the ‘Maison des potes – Maison de l’égalité’ association on grounds of public incitement to racial or religious discrimination and announced in plenary on 8 June 2016

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: in writing. - The French association 'Maison des potes - Maison de l'égalité' has accused Jean-François Jalkh MEP of committing public incitement to national, racial or religious discrimination. The Prosecutor of the Court of Appeal of Versailles requested that the immunity of the Member be waived in connection with the related court proceedings. The complaint concerned statements in a brochure entitled 'Handbook for Local Government Representatives of the Front National' published on the Front National Association's website, and Jean-François Jalkh, Director of Front National Publications, exercised editorial control over all the Association's websites. The Committee on Legal Affairs points out in its report that the allegations are clearly not related to Jean-François Jalkh's MEPs, but only to would intend to obstruct the parliamentary work of the He therefore proposed that Parliament waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh. That is how I voted.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: in writing.- This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity undoubtedly has a political dimension, since it follows a procedure against the FN deputy Jean-François Jalkh for publication, on the local site of an FN federation of which hewas not director of publication, appealing to national preference.This request cannot be sustained.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: in writing. - I am opposed to this request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity, which relates to persecution, for the following cumulative reasons: - the fact that after more than two years of investigation, Justice still claims to ignore that Mr. Jalkh is not director of the publication of the FN 66 site nor of the Front National paper works; - the fact that the present request for waiver of the immunity of Mr. Jalkh was signed on the same day (April 14, 2016) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian, whereas these cases relate to facts that occurred in different periods; - the fact that it is affirmed that the present request for waiver of immunity is the result of a judicial investigation opened to the prosecution of the Nanterre tribunal de grande instance against Mr. Jalkh, which is false, since was a complaint against X; - the fact that the present request relates to an element of the National Front's program which has never been challenged by the courts in the party's 44 years of existence.

name: József NAGY
text: in writing.- I support the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.Public actors are often wrongly accused of their work and communications, yet these communications must not violate fundamental values and, for example, must not give rise to racial or religious discrimination.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for this report according to the evaluation made by the JURI Committee.

name: Demetris PAPADAKIS
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of lifting the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh in relation to the alleged offense of incitement to discrimination, racial hatred and violence against a person or group of persons on the grounds of their origin or membership or non-membership of a particular ethnic group race or religion, an offense provided for under French law following a complaint brought by the Maison des Potes - Maison de l'égalité. In order to enjoy immunity, a Member of the European Parliament must give his or her opinion in the performance of his or her duties, and there must therefore be a link between the opinion expressed and the parliamentary duties. However, Jean-François Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament when the alleged offense took place, ie on 19 September and 30 November 2013. However, this alleged offensive material was accessible to anyone who wished it on 23 June and 2 October 2014. The case must therefore be taken up by the justice of the French Republic.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: in writing.- To initiate proceedings against elected officials on the pretext that they demand in their program a change in the existing legislation is an extremely dangerous antidemocratic drift in so far as it is a particularly serious attack on freedom of opinion.I obviously support my colleague Jean-François Jalkh in this matter and vote against the lifting of his immunity.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: written. - Jean-François Jalkh is charged in a lawsuit filed by the Maison des potes - Maison de l'égalité with the Nanterre Regional Court on 22 May 2014, and the Public Prosecutor of the Court of Appeal in Versailles requested that the immunity of a Member of the European Parliament be waived. in connection with the lawsuit. The waiver of immunity refers to the alleged criminal offense of public incitement to discrimination based on nationality, race or religion. Jean-François Jalkh was Front National's director of publications with editorial responsibility for all of the party's websites at the time of publication of the brochures to which the lawsuit relates.
