Statements made in the brochure “Petit guide pratique de l’élu municipal Front National” (Handbook for Local Councilors in the Front National Party), published on 19 September 2013 and posted on the official website of the Front National Party on 30 November 2013, all members of the Front National party elected to the position of local councilor in the elections held on 23 and 30 March 2014 urge to issue a recommendation at the first session of the new local council that priority be given to French citizens when allocating social housing (“priorité nationale”). The accusation is clearly not related to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament, but relates exclusively to national or regional action.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing. - The request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh is related to an alleged offense of public incitement to discrimination based on nationality, race or religion, made orally, in writing, by images or by means of communication to the public via by person or person unknown, offense punished by French law. The complaint concerns a brochure entitled "Small practical guide for councilors by the National Front", which encouraged candidates from the National Front elected as councilors in the elections of 23 and 30 March 2014, to recommend in the new municipal bodies, that it be priority was given to French citizens to allocate social housing. Jean-François Jalkh was the director of publications for the National Front and had editorial control over all of the federation's websites. He was not, at the time, a member of the EP. The charges relate to activities of a purely national or regional nature prior to this condition. There is nothing to suspect the existence of an attempt to obstruct Jean-François Jalkh's parliamentary work through the judicial inquiry launched. We voted in favor.

name: Julia REID
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing.- The alleged actions do not concern opinions or votes expressed by the MEP in the exercise of his duties.The European Parliament decides to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: written. - I voted in favor of suspending the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, in view of the report prepared by the Legal Affairs Committee, which states that the prosecutor of the Versailles Court of Appeal has requested such suspension in relation to an alleged crime of incitement to national, racial or religious discrimination after the complaint filed against him for the statements made in a pamphlet entitled "Petit guide pratique de l'élu municipal Front national" (Practical guide to the elected office of the National Front), published on 19 of September 2013 and published on the official website of the Federation of the National Front on November 30, 2013, which incited the candidates of the National Front elected councilors in the elections held on March 23 and 30, 2014 to recommend, from the first plenary session of the new municipalities, the defense of the "national priority" in matters of attribution of social housing, being Jean-François Jalkh director of publications of the National Front. Given that Jean-François Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament at the time the alleged crime was committed and since the charges are not manifestly related to his status as a Member of the European Parliament, I have decided to vote in favor.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of lifting the immunity of Mr. Jean-François Jalkh, so that the French justice can carry out its work, in strict respect of the rights of the defense, it being understood that the incriminated statements (request to privilegethe French in access to social housing) have no direct link with the function of MEP of Mr. Jalkh, since the incriminated statements concern candidates for the function of municipal councilor for the municipal elections.They are linked to his position as director of publications for the Front National and are therefore not motivated by any desire to harm his function as MEP.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: in writing.- Any accusation by a law enforcement official against a Member of the European Parliament must be taken seriously.We cannot allow the mandate of a Member of the European Parliament to become an opportunity to evade responsibility.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of the parliamentary immunity of François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France for his discriminatory and racist statements.The aforementioned statements do not have to do with his parliamentary work, they are nothing but an expression of his deplorable far-right position.I have therefore voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his incitement to racism and hatred.

name: Jill SEYMOUR
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this as this offence took place before he was an MEP.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing - I supported the motion for an EP resolution waiving the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh MEP. The request for the waiver of immunity was made by the French Minister of Justice and Freedom in connection with a judicial inquiry against Jean-Francois Jalkh at the Nanterre Regional Court following a joint submission by the Maison des potes for public incitement to racial and religious discrimination. The allegations are demonstrably unrelated to Jean-Francois Jalkh's role as a Member of the European Parliament and relate to activities of a purely national and regional nature, and the statements were made to potential MEPs in connection with the March 2014 municipal elections and his role as Director of Public Affairs. queue, which exercised editorial control over all the movement's websites. His conduct was not related to the views expressed or the votes cast in the performance of his duties as a Member of the European Parliament, and there was therefore no reason to reject the request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: in writing. - The Public Prosecutor of the Court of Appeal in Versailles requests the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, Member of the European Parliament, in connection with the trial for the alleged crime. The request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh is linked to the alleged offense of publicly inciting discrimination on the grounds of nationality, race or religion in spoken or written form or by means of images or public electronic correspondence. The lawsuit relates to statements from a leaflet entitled "Handbook for Local Councilors of the National Front", published on 19 September 2013 and published on 30 November 2013 on the official website of the National Front Federation, which promoted the party's candidates elected local councilors in the elections. On 23 and 30 March 2014, at the first session of the new local council, to recommend the priority treatment of the French (so-called priorité nationale) in the allocation of social housing. Jean-François Jalkh was the head of publications at the National Front and had editorial control over all the federation's websites. I find this behavior unacceptable to an MEP, and I myself strongly condemn the promotion of hate speech or discrimination based on religion, gender or race. I believe that the French authorities should be given the opportunity to convict people of this behavior, which is why I voted in favor of waiving the immunity of MEP Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: in writing - The European Parliament waived the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh at the request of the French Minister for Justice and Freedom in connection with a judicial inquiry.Jean-François Jalkh is accused of publishing a brochure entitled Handbook for Local Front MPs, recommending that National Front candidates in the first session of the new local council recommend giving preference to French in the allocation of social housing (the so-callednational priority).

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: written.- Jean-François Jalkh is charged in a lawsuit filed by the Maison des potes - Maison de l’égalité on 22 May 2014 with the Regional Court in Nanterre (France).The indictment relates to statements made in the brochure “Petit guide pratique de l’élu municipal Front National” (Handbook for Local Councilors in the Front National Party).The accusation is clearly not related to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament, but only to national or regional action.I support the report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, as the alleged acts do not involve the expression of opinion or the vote of Members of the European Parliament.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: in writing.The waiver of immunity should cover only acts falling within the scope of parliamentary duties.In this report, the facts described in the documentation of the accusations have nothing to do with real crimes but only with malicious lawsuits from political opponents, in order to damage the prestige of the MEP and to hinder his work.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: in writing.- I voted positively on the request for the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh so that he can defend himself before the courts of his country.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh, who faces two cases of litigation. The first case relates an offence of public incitement of discrimination, hatred and violence, by where Mr Jalkh, the publishing editor of the National Front´s website, posted the interview by where Jean-Marie Le Pen suggested to “put them all in the oven together next time”, when referencing the Jewish people. The second case relates public incitement to discrimination, based on statements Jalkh published in the National Front´s “Handbook for Front National local councillors”, encouraging FN candidates, if elected, to give priority to French people when allocating social housing. As both charges are unrelated to Mr. Jalkh’s work in the EP and do not reflect the opinions of a Member of the EP, I believe that his immunity should be waived.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: written. - The French Minister of Justice and Freedom has sent a request to the European Parliament to waive the immunity of MP Jean-François Jalkh due to a court investigation into the alleged crime of public incitement to discrimination based on nationality, race or religion orally or in writing or using images or electronic public publication by an unknown person or persons. Namely, the association “Maison des potes - Maison de l’égalité” filed a lawsuit against Jalkh on 22 May 2014, referring to the statements given in the brochure of the Front National party published on 19 September 2013, with recommendations to apartments give preference to French citizens. A court investigation will be launched against Jalkh as he was the party's director of publications at the time and had editorial responsibility for all of the party's website. Given that Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament at the time and there is no doubt that this lawsuit seeks to interfere with his parliamentary work, I supported the request for the waiver of immunity.

name: Romana TOMC
text: in writing.- I supported the proposal for a European Parliament decision on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh.The Public Prosecutor of the Court of Appeal in Versailles requests the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, Member of the European Parliament, in connection with the trial for the alleged crime.He was not yet a Member of the European Parliament during this period, so this activity is of a regional-local nature.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: in writing. - This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity stems from a fumus persecutionis, a scent of persecution, for the following cumulative reasons: the fact that after more than two years of investigation, the Justice still claims to ignore that Mr. Jalkh no he is not director of the publication of the FN 66 Site nor of the Front National paper works; the fact that the present request for the waiver of the immunity of Mr. Jalkh was signed on the same day (April 14, 2016) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian, whereas these cases relate to facts that occurred at different periods; the fact that it is claimed that the present request for waiver of immunity follows a judicial investigation opened to the prosecution of the Nanterre tribunal de grande instance against Mr. Jalkh, which is false, since it is 'was a complaint against X; the fact that the present request relates to an element of the program of the National Front which has never been challenged by justice in 44 years of existence of this party. I therefore obviously give my full support to my colleague, Jean-François Jalkh, by opposing the lifting of his parliamentary immunity.

name: Kazimierz Michał UJAZDOWSKI
text: in writing.- The request of the French prosecutor's office to waive the parliamentary immunity of Mr Jalkh is related to the court proceedings on public incitement to racial hatred in the film "Interview with Jean-Marie Le Pen", which was published on the official website of the National Front and on a blog.It is obvious that the alleged offense is clearly linked to the function of a member of the European Parliament and results from his performance as a member of the National Front Council.I voted in favor of the request for the waiver of immunity.

name: István UJHELYI
text: in writing.- The request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh relates to an alleged criminal offense of public incitement to discriminate against a national, racially or religiously, by oral, written, pictorial or electronic communication to the public, which is a criminal offense under French law.I followed the group's position with my vote.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the Report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh. The waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh was forwarded on 14 April 2016 by the French Minister of Justice and Liberties in connection with a judicial inquiry opened against Mr Jalkh that relates to an alleged offence of public incitement to discrimination on grounds of nationality, race or religion by word of mouth, in written form or by means of images or electronic public communication by a person or persons unknown. I voted in favour because Mr Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament when the alleged offence took place and the charges are manifestly unrelated to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament. Moreover, the alleged actions do not relate to opinions expressed or votes cast by the Member of the European Parliament in the performance of his duties and there is no suspicion of any attempt to obstruct the parliamentary work of Jean-François Jalkh behind the judicial inquiry.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of the parliamentary immunity of François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France for his discriminatory and racist statements.The aforementioned statements do not have to do with his parliamentary work, they are nothing but an expression of his deplorable far-right position.I have therefore voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his incitement to racism and hatred.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: written.- I voted in favor because Jean-François Jalkh was not yet a Member of the European Parliament at the time of the events, September 19 and November 30, 2013 respectively, but the contested content was still accessible online on June 23 and October 2, 2014.anyone who wanted to know about it.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing.- The accusations are manifestly unrelated to the post of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament and concern activities of a purely national or regional nature.The alleged actions do not concern opinions or votes expressed by the MEP in the exercise of his duties.There is nothing to suspect the existence of an attempt to obstruct the parliamentary work of Jean-François Jalkh behind the judicial inquiry launched following a complaint by the association “Maison des potes - Maison de l'égalité”, filed before Jean-François Jalkhhave taken up office in the European Parliament.We therefore approved the survey.

name: Jana ŽITŇANSKÁ
text: in writing - I supported both reports on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh, Member of the European Parliament.In both cases, the French prosecutor is asking for the waiver of immunity for prosecution for alleged public incitement of discrimination and racial hatred.As none of these cases concern the parliamentary activities of Mr Jalkh, I see no reason for him to be protected by parliamentary immunity in criminal proceedings.It applies to Members of the European Parliament only if the act for which the prosecution is to take place has taken place during the parliamentary term and is clearly linked to his parliamentary activities.

name: Milan ZVER
text: in writing.- I supported the Report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, as the allegations are clearly not related to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament and are in fact related to activities of a purely national or regional nature.There is also no suspicion that this is a judicial inquiry initiated on the basis of a request for an attempt to obstruct the parliamentary work of Jean-François Jalkh (fumus persecutionis), as the request was made before he became a Member of the European Parliament.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing.- The following dossier concerns the waiver of the immunity of the French deputy Jean-François Jalkh, accused by the association "Bureau national de vigilance contre l'antisemitisme" of public incitement to discrimination, hatred and violence.The accusation was brought because Jean-François Jalkh was the director in charge of the publications of the Front National website who released an interview containing a very violent sentence.I consider these statements absolutely unacceptable and equally serious the fact that they have been made public and for these reasons I have decided to vote in favor.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of parliamentary immunity to François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France as responsible for the publication of clearly Nazi-fascist statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen.Jean-François Jalkh was the director of the official website of the Front National, which published statements by Le Pen, which precisely also led to the suspension of his parliamentary immunity.Taking into account that these events have nothing to do with his parliamentary work, but are nothing more than an expression of his deplorable far-right position, I have voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his complicity and promotion of incitementto racism and hatred.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. – I voted in favour of the waiver of Mr Jalkh’s parliamentary immunity. This case relates to a similar case for waiver from the last plenary concerning statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen against the Jewish community. The MEP in question in the present case was the publications director and online editor for Front National at the time these statements were made, and was responsible for the uploading and dissemination of content containing statements inciting discrimination, hatred and violence. For these reasons I voted for the waiver.

name: Eric ANDRIEU
text: in writing.- I voted for the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing.- This second request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity of MP JF Jalkh is motivated only by partisan reasons.This request is totally disproportionate in so far as Mr. JALKH never said he wanted to evade a summons from the investigating judge if his immunity was waived.A simple summons or a simple summons to appear would have sufficed.So I voted against this unwarranted waiver of immunity.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ Requests for immunity waivers are not the subject of roll-call votes. In the interests of democracy and transparency I would therefore like to confirm that I voted to waive the immunity. My reason for this is straightforward, and completely unconnected to the circumstances of the case or any allegations: immunity does not cover events which occurred before the start of an MEP’s mandate.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing.- The Prosecutor General of the Paris Court of Appeal has requested that the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho MEP be waived.Jean-François Jalkh has been accused by the National Vigilance Bureau of fighting anti-Semitism.As Jean-François Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament when the act was committed, moreover, the allegations clearly do not relate to Jean-François Jalkh's duties as a Member of the European Parliament.I therefore support the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho.

name: Gerard BATTEN
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- Fumus persecutionis.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- In accordance with the recommendation of the Committee on Legal Affairs, I voted in favor of Mr Jalkh's immunity.

name: Beatriz BECERRA BASTERRECHEA
text: written. - I voted in favor of suspending the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh because he is accused by his position of director of publications of the official website of the National Front for the statements of Jean-Marie Le Pen, disclosed on the "frontnational website." com "and later on the blog" jeanmarielepen.com "on June 6, 2014, in response to the mention, by a participant, of the name of singer Patrick Bruel, who had stated that he could no longer perform in the cities of their choice to a mayor of the National Front: «No wonder. Look, next time we will put them through the oven »; considering that Jean-François Jalkh was the director of publications of the official website of the National Front. These statements are a clear incitement to hatred and I consider it appropriate to withdraw his immunity since for a Member of the European Parliament to be protected by immunity, he must have issued his opinion in the exercise of his functions, which implies the requirement of a relationship between the opinion expressed and the parliamentary functions. And this relationship must be direct and clearly imposed. In this case he does not respond to any of these circumstances, given that the actions were prior to his position as MEP.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing.- Following the recommendations of the Legal Affairs Committee, I voted in favor of the request for waiver of immunity for Mr Jean-François Jalkh.The Honorable Member was accused by the association "Bureau national de vigilance contre l'antisémitisme" for the alleged crime of public incitement to discrimination on grounds of nationality, racial or religious origin in relation to statements made by Jean-Marie Le Pen during ainterview published on the website "frontnational.com", of which Jalkh was the director responsible for publications. The Commission verified that there was no connection between the post held at that time and the parliamentary functions of Jean-François Jalkh and,not suspecting the presence of fumus persecutionis, he decided to waive its immunity.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report and therefore waiving Mr Jalkh's parliamentary immunity, as in the previous report.It will be the relevant courts in your country that decide whether or not you have committed a crime, but it is our job to suspend immunity so that the fact can be tried.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing. - This other request for the lifting of immunity concerns proceedings, by the public prosecutor of Paris, against Jean-François Jalkh as director of the publication of the site frontnational.com, in particular because of an interview of June 6 2014 by Mr. Jean-Marie Le Pen, interviewed on Mr. Yannick Noah and Mr. Patrick Bruel, which was published on his blog hosted by the frontnational.com site. Due to its character not in accordance with the communication policy desired by Ms. Marine Le Pen, this interview was immediately withdrawn from the site and Mr. Jean-Marie Le Pen's blog no longer has, following this affair, was hosted by the FN site. This request for waiver of immunity is a persecution, as for the previous one, with similar explanations, but also due to the fact that Mr. Jalkh never said he wanted to evade a summons from the investigating judge or even the fact that it is totally contrary to the fundamental democratic principle of equality of litigants before the law, since the request for the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of the main author of the incriminated remarks, Mr. Le Pen, is not due all justified, it, by the need to issue a warrant. So I voted against it.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- I took part in the vote on the Chrysogonos report.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written.- I voted in favor of suspending the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, in view of the report prepared by the Legal Affairs Committee, which states that the prosecutor of the Paris Court of Appeal has requested such suspension in relation to an alleged crime ofincitement to discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or a group of people on the grounds of their origin or of their belonging to an ethnic group, a nation, a race or a specific religion, a crime classified under French law,when Jean-François Jalkh had not assumed his duties as a Member of the European Parliament and having found that the charges were not manifestly related to his status as a Member of the European Parliament.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report because it decided to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho from France. This waiver of immunity relates to a pre-trial investigation launched against Jean-François Jalkh in the Paris District Court following a complaint from the National Anti-Semitic Vigilance Bureau (BNVCA) in a civil action alleging public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence. The complaint states that in 2014 June 6 in an interview published on the website frontnational.com and later on the blog jeanmarielepen.com, Jean-Marie Le Pen, in response to the fact that one participant mentioned the name of the singer Patrick Bruel and his words that he will no longer sing in the cities where the mayor will be elected A spokesman for the National Front said: “It doesn’t surprise me. Listen, let's light the stove next time. " At the time, Jean-François Jalkh was the publishing director of the official National Front website. Jean-François Jalkh was not a Member of the European Parliament when the act was committed and the allegations are clearly unrelated to Jean-François Jalkh's duties as a Member of the European Parliament.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: in writing.- I agree with the request for the waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh,- Maison de l'égalité for the consolidation of legal proceedings concerning the public promotion of racial or religious discrimination.I personally consider such public incitement to racial or religious discrimination to be extremely inappropriate and unworthy of a person in such a position.

name: Biljana BORZAN
text: written.- I support this Report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing. - During an interview dated June 6, 2014 on his blog, Jean-Marie Le Pen was asked about Yannick Noah's promise to leave France in the event of Marine Le Pen's victory in the presidential elections and on the refusal of Patrick BRUEL to perform in the municipalities managed by the National Front, before concluding: "next time, we will do a batch ...". Because of its character not in conformity with the communication policy desired by the President of the National Front, this interview was immediately withdrawn from the site. In addition, Jean-Marie Le Pen's blog was no longer hosted by the Front National site as a result of this affair. Jean-François Jalkh is being prosecuted by the public prosecutor of Paris as director of the site's publication. This request is totally disproportionate insofar as Jean-François Jalkh has never stated that he wants to evade a summons from the investigating judge if his immunity is lifted. I therefore opposed his lifting of parliamentary immunity, which is a fumus persecutionis.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: in writing.- We support the request for the waiver of immunity, bearing in mind that there is no suspicion of an attempt to obstruct Jean-François Jalkh's parliamentary activity in the context of the judicial inquiry, which was launched following a lawsuit filed by the National Bureau of Anti-Semitism (BNVCA) ».

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: in writing.- We voted on the request for the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.As this request does not concern procedures related to his parliamentary activity, I believe that we must not stand in the way of justice.That is why I voted in favor.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report because from the analysis of the facts presented by the Attorney General to the Court of Appeal of Versailles, it became clear that the commission of the alleged crime, denounced by the association "Bureau national de vigilance contre l'antisémitisme (BNCVA)", did not take place during the exercise of the duties of MEP of Jean-Francois Jalkh and considering the non-existence of a fumus persecutionis against the deputy, there was no reason to maintain immunity.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ I support the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of a Member of the European Parliament, Jean-François Jalkh, in connection with a legal action concerning an alleged offence and therefore agree that the report of concerned committee would be communicated immediately to the concerned parties.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of parliamentary immunity to François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France as responsible for the publication of clearly Nazi-fascist statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen.Jean-François Jalkh was the director of the official website of the Front National, which published statements by Le Pen, which precisely also led to the suspension of his parliamentary immunity.Taking into account that these events have nothing to do with his parliamentary work, but are nothing more than an expression of his deplorable ultra-rightist position, I have voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his complicity and promotion of incitementto racism and hatred.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing.- The parliamentary immunity conferred by Article 8 of the Protocol applies only to the views expressed by Members of the European Parliament in the performance of their duties.I therefore intended to vote in favor of this decision since, as there is no direct and obvious link between the contested statements and the functions of Jean-Francois Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament, these statements, made in the context of a national political debate, are notrelated neither to his work as a Member of the European Parliament nor to the policies of the European Union.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: in writing.- I support the request for the waiver of Jean-François Jalkh's immunity.A criminal case is pending against the MEP in a French court.The MEP has been charged with public incitement to racial or religious hatred through words.Immunity cannot be a means of avoiding liability, especially if the allegations relate to a period when the person was not a MEP, as was the case here.The alleged acts extend their effects in the country of origin of the MEP, in this respect there is no doubt that the immunity limits the possibilities of the French court to enforce the law.The rapporteur recommends lifting immunity, and I think the same.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of waving the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh as this will give the relevant authorities the opportunity to investigate the case in question and ensure justice is done

name: William (The Earl of) DARTMOUTH
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: in writing.- I voted against this report.An interview with Jean-Marie Le Pen on June 6, 2014 on his blog hosted by the “frontnational.com” site focused on Mr. Yannick Noah's promise to leave France in the event of victory for the National Front and on Mr.Patrick Bruel to perform in Front National municipalities.On the form, the need to issue a warrant is questionable, since Mr. Jalkh has never claimed to want to evade justice.In addition, Mr. Jalkh was indeed director of publication at the time of going live, but left this post shortly thereafter in view of his European mandate.Finally, the contentious video was very quickly removed from the site.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: in writing.- I oppose the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.The waiver of immunity should cover only acts falling within the scope of parliamentary duties.In this report, the facts described as accusations have nothing to do with real crimes but only malicious lawsuits by political opponents, in order to damage the MEP's prestige and hinder his work.

name: Rosa ESTARÀS FERRAGUT
text: written.- Under Article 9 of Protocol 7, Members of the European Parliament enjoy, within their national territory, the immunities accorded to the parliamentarians of their Member State.Referring to the French Constitution, article 26 indicates that no member of the French Parliament may be prosecuted, investigated, detained, imprisoned or tried for opinions or votes that he has cast in the exercise of his functions.Considering, firstly, that Jean -François Jalkh was not a European parliamentarian at the time the alleged crime was committed, and, secondly, that no relationship is found between his status as a member of parliament and the charges against him, the Legal Affairs Committee recommends that the European Parliament waive the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: in writing.- Vote against: the request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity is a fumus persecutionis.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - The report concerns the request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity by the Public Prosecutor of the Paris Court of Appeal, MEP Jean-François Jalkh, in connection with a lawsuit relating to an alleged offense of incitement to discrimination, to hatred or violence against a person or a group of people because of their origin or their belonging or not to a specific ethnicity, nation, race or religion, punished by French law, an accusation carried out by the National Anti-Fraud Office Anti-Semitism (BNVCA), in a complaint made following statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen in an interview broadcast on the website "frontnational.com" and later on the blog "jeanmarielepen.com", after a reference by a member of the public to the name of singer Patrick Bruel. The accusations are manifestly unrelated to the post of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament and concern activities of a purely national or regional nature, given that the statements refer to the local elections held in March 2014 and to the his post as director of publications of the National Front with editorial control over all the federation's Internet sites. We voted in favor of waiving parliamentary immunity.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: in writing.- I oppose the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.The waiver of immunity should cover only acts falling within the scope of parliamentary duties.In this report, the facts described as accusations have nothing to do with real crimes but only malicious lawsuits by political opponents, in order to damage the MEP's prestige and hinder his work.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ The charges are manifestly unrelated to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament and concern instead activities of a purely national or regional nature, given that the statements related to the local elections in France held on 23 and 30 March 2014 and to his position as the Front National’s publications director with editorial control over the federation’s websites. I therefore supported the decision to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- I voted in favor of the waiver of immunity from Jean-François Jalkh (Front National).The European Parliament is responding to a request from the French judiciary and paving the way for an appropriate, transparent procedure.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of waiving the immunity of Mr Jalkh.

name: Bruno GOLLNISCH
text: in writing. - I voted against the two requests for waiver of immunity concerning my colleague Jean-François Jalkh. They come under the usual double standards applied by this assembly, quick to protect "Eurobeat" deputies and to deliver others to the (un) justice of their country. Even if the Parliament claims not to judge on the merits, it does not cease to do so, in particular in the cases of alleged crimes connected with the political expression. As to the "form" he claims to respect, he has gone very far in denial, with the case of Mr. Jalkh ignoring the fact that one of the requests for waiver of immunity was filed for the express purpose of issuing a warrant. However, in terms of press offenses, the latter is not legal in France. Finally, authorizing the persecution of a MEP on the grounds that at the time of the events he was not yet elected to Parliament, is an argument of rare hypocrisy: it is indeed the desire to hamper the MEP in his activity. parliamentarian and its reputation which motivates many lawsuits, especially in France.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: in writing.- We voted in favor of the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of MEP Jean-François Jalkh of the National Front (France), so that the judicial investigation against him can proceed by the French judiciary for inciting racist and anti-Semitic behavior and practices.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour since I have no objections

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament on the request for waiver of immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh because it is a lawsuit for the alleged crime of incitement to discrimination that occurred before Mr. Jalkh took office as a Member of the European Parliament.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- I voted for Jean-François Jalkh's immunity to be lifted because the accusation against him is in no way linked to the exercise of his mandate.The case which concerns him as publication director of the National Front websites is particularly serious, linked to complaints against Mr. Le Pen's video calling for a "batch" for personalities.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: in writing. - During an interview on June 6, 2014 on his blog hosted by the frontnational.com site, Mr. Jean-Marie Le Pen was questioned about Mr. Yannick Noah's promise to leave France in the event of the National Front winning, and on the refusal of Mr. Patrick Bruel to perform in FN municipalities. And to conclude: "next time, we will do a batch ...". By its character not in conformity with the policy of communication wanted by the new president of the FN Ms. Marine Le Pen, this interview was withdrawn from the site. In addition, Jean-Marie Le Pen's blog was no longer hosted by the National Front site as a result of this affair. Jean-François Jalkh is being sued by the Paris public prosecutor as director of publication for the frontnational.com site. This request is disproportionate, as Mr. Jalkh has never said he wanted to evade a summons from the investigating judge if his immunity was waived. A simple summons or a simple summons to appear would have sufficed. I therefore opposed his waiver of immunity.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of parliamentary immunity to François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France as responsible for the publication of clearly Nazi-fascist statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen.Jean-François Jalkh was the director of the official website of the Front National, which published statements by Le Pen, which precisely also led to the suspension of his parliamentary immunity.Taking into account that these events have nothing to do with his parliamentary work, but are nothing more than an expression of his deplorable far-right position, I have voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his complicity and promotion of incitementto racism and hatred.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: written.- The Public Prosecutor of the Court of Appeal in Paris has requested the lifting of parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, Member of the European Parliament, in connection with a lawsuit for alleged incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or group based on origin or ethnicity, nation, race or religion, by an act punishable under French law.This accusation is not related to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament, but relates exclusively to national or regional action, given that the statements were related to the local elections held in France on 23 and 30 March 2014 and to histhe position of Director of Publications in the Front National Party responsible for the Website.Because of all of the above, I supported this report.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: in writing - The French authorities requested the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh in connection with his investigation into the alleged criminal offense of incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or group of persons based on origin or ethnicity, race, nation or religion, which he was to have committed under French law.The request is in accordance with the Rules of Procedure and Protocol No.7 on the privileges and immunities of the European Union, which is why I supported the proposal to waive immunity.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, following the positive recommendation of the Committee on Legal Affairs of the European Parliament.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: in writing.- I voted against lifting Jean-François Jalkh's immunity.Mr. Jalkh is concerned as Director of the publication of the frontnational.com site, because of a publication hosted on this site, although the latter was withdrawn the same day from its hosting, and that these facts are prior tohis election.This anteriority of the facts, the fact that the Paris prosecutor justifies his request for the waiver of immunity by the need to issue a warrant (disproportionate request, contrary to the procedure in the event of a press offense), as well as thefact that there is only one complaint against X treated as a complaint against Mr. Jalkh, show that this request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity is indeed a fumus persecutionis.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing.- I expressed my opinion against Mr Jalkh's request for waiver of immunity as I believe that parliamentary immunity is not a personal privilege of a Member but a guarantee of the independence of Parliament and its members as an independent institution..I remain convinced that in these cases a guarantee line must be followed and consequently I will continue to vote negatively for this type of relationship in defense of the institutional role conferred by this Parliament.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: in writing.- I support the decision to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkho.The French law enforcement authorities must be able to question the Member and find out all the circumstances surrounding the allegations of incitement to racial and religious discrimination.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: in writing. - The report calls for the parliamentary immunity of the far-right MP Jean-François Jalkh to be lifted. Indeed Jean-François Jalkh is being prosecuted following a complaint from the National Office for Vigilance Against Antisemitism (BNVCA) in August 2014. The complaint relates to statements made by Jean-Marie Le Pen during a broadcast interview on the "frontnational.com" website, during which he allegedly said about Patrick Bruel: "That doesn't surprise me. Listen, we'll do a batch next time ”. Considering that Jean-François Jalkh was the publications director of the official website of the National Front, he can be held responsible for the comments posted on this site. Since the accusations are not related to his mandate as MEP but to his position as director of publications of the National Front responsible for editorial control of all the federation's websites, I vote for the lifting of immunity.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: in writing.- This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity concerning Jean-François Jalkh, emanates from the public prosecutor of Paris who is suing Mr. Jalkh, as director of the publication of the frontnational.com site, on the grounds that it was publishedin June 2014 an interview with Jean-Marie LE PEN during which he said the word "batch".The Paris prosecutor justifies this request for the waiver of immunity by the need to issue a warrant.This is disproportionate since J-F.Jalkh never said he wanted to evade a summons from the investigating judge if his immunity was waived.This request stemmed from a certain persecution of members and elected members of the National Front by the French courts, so I opposed it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. - The defense of the independence of the MEP's mandate falls within the competence of the European Parliament and that independence cannot be called into question. In the present case, the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh was submitted on 14 April 2016 by the French Minister for Justice and Freedoms, in the context of a judicial inquiry (case no. 1422400530) brought against Jean- François Jalkh, at the Paris District Court, following a civil complaint filed by the National Anti-Semitic Vigilance Organization (BNVCA), for public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence, which was communicated in plenary session on 8 June 2016. The alleged actions do not relate to opinions or votes expressed by the Member of the European Parliament in the exercise of his functions, within the meaning of Article 8 of Protocol No. 7 on the Privileges and Immunities of the European Union. I vote in favor of this proposal.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: in writing. - The French Minister of Justice has requested the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of Mr. J-Fr. Jalkh as director of the publications of the official website of the National Front, following a complaint from the “National Office for Vigilance Against Antisemitism (BNVCA)”, due to statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen made during an interview during which he allegedly made statements of public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence. Article 9 of Protocol No. 7 on the privileges and immunities of the EU stipulates that members of the EP enjoy, on their national territory, the immunities granted to members of the parliament of their state and Article 8 of Protocol No. 7 notifies that members of the European Parliament may not be searched for, detained or prosecuted for opinions or votes cast by them in the exercise of their functions. As Mr Jean-François Jalkh had not taken up his duties as Member of the European Parliament at the time of the facts and that the accusations made are not linked to his function as Member of the European Parliament but relate to activities of a purely national or regional nature , I decided to vote in favor of waiving the applicant's immunity.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, because I am in agreement with the decision, forwarded on 14 April 2016 by the French Minister of Justice and Liberties, in connection with a judicial inquiry (file No 1422400530) opened against Mr Jean-François Jalkh at the Paris District Court in response to an application with joinder filed by the Association ‘National Office for Vigilance against Anti-Semitism (BNVCA)’ on grounds of public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence and announced in plenary on 8 June 2016.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: in writing. - At the request of the French National Bureau for the Monitoring of Anti-Semitism (BNVCA), an investigation was opened before the Paris District Court against Jean-François Jalkh MEP for public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence. The prosecutor of the Paris Court of Appeal requested that the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh be waived in connection with the investigation. The complaint related to statements made by Jean-Marie Le Pen in an interview posted on "frontnational.com" and the director responsible for publishing the Front National's official website was Jean-François Jalkh. The report of the Committee on Legal Affairs states that the allegations are clearly not related to Jean-François Jalkh's MEP, but only to his position as Director of Front National publications and editorial control over the association's websites, and therefore proposes that Parliament suspend Jean-François Jalkh immunity. That is how I voted.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: in writing.- This second request for lifting of immunity, for a publication on the website of the Front National of the remarks of its honorary president, clearly relate to a political reason, which is not a valid cause for liftingimmunity.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: in writing. - I am opposed to this request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity, which relates to persecution, for the following cumulative reasons: - the fact that after more than two years of investigation, Justice still claims to ignore that Mr. Jalkh is not director of the publication of the FN 66 site nor of the Front National paper works; - the fact that the present request for waiver of the immunity of Mr. Jalkh was signed on the same day (April 14, 2016) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian, whereas these cases relate to facts that occurred in different periods; - the fact that it is affirmed that the present request for waiver of immunity is the result of a judicial investigation opened to the prosecution of the Nanterre tribunal de grande instance against Mr. Jalkh, which is false, since was a complaint against X; - the fact that the present request relates to an element of the National Front's program which has never been challenged by the courts in the party's 44 years of existence.

name: József NAGY
text: in writing.- I support the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.Public actors are often wrongly accused of their work and communications, yet these communications must not violate fundamental values and, for example, must not give rise to racial or religious discrimination.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for this report according to the evaluation made by the JURI Committee.

name: Demetris PAPADAKIS
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of lifting the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh in relation to the alleged offense of incitement to discrimination, racial hatred and violence against a person or group of persons on the grounds of their origin or membership or non-membership of a particular ethnic group race or religion, an offense provided for under French law, following a lawsuit filed by the National Bureau of Anti-Semitism (BNVCA). In order to enjoy immunity, a Member of the European Parliament must give his or her opinion in the performance of his or her duties, and there must therefore be a link between the opinion expressed and the parliamentary duties. However, these allegations do not relate to Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament. On the contrary, they concern activities of a purely national and regional character, given that the statements concerned the local elections in France, which took place on Sunday 23 and Sunday 30 March 2014, and his capacity as director of publications of the National Front. The case must therefore be brought to justice by the French Republic.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: in writing. - This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity is indeed a fumus persecutionis, the scent of persecution for the following cumulative reasons: the fact that the present request for the lifting of Mr Jalkh's immunity was signed on the same day ( April 14, 2016) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian when these cases relate to events occurring at different times; the fact that the Paris public prosecutor justified his request for the lifting of Mr. Jalkh's parliamentary immunity by the need to issue a warrant of arrest while, in terms of the press, the investigating chamber of the Court of Paris appeal has already had the opportunity to censor the issuance of an arrest warrant (Paris Court of Appeal, judgment of May 15, 2009, file n ° 2008/06790); the fact that some can affirm that the present request for waiver of immunity follows a judicial investigation opened to the prosecution of the Paris tribunal de grande instance against Mr. JALKH, or a complaint against Mr. JALKH before the dean of the examining magistrates, which is false in both cases, since it was a complaint against X. I support my colleague in this matter and vote against his lifting of immunity.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: written. - The Bureau national de vigilance contre l'antisémitisme charges Jean-François Jalkh in a lawsuit filed with the competent prosecutor in Paris on 12 August 2014, and the public prosecutor of the Court of Appeal in Paris requested the waiver of parliamentary immunity for a Member of the European Parliament. The waiver of immunity is linked to the alleged offense of inciting discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or group of persons on the grounds of origin or belonging to or belonging to a particular ethnic group, nation, race or religion, an offense punishable under French law. Jean-François Jalkh was the director of publications for the official website of the Front National party at the time the controversial statements were published on that website. The lawsuit relates to statements made by Jean-Marie Le Pen during an interview published on the website "frontnational.com" and then on the blog "jeanmarielepen.com" on June 6, 2014, in response to the mention of the name of the singer Patrick Bruela in the audience, who previously stated that he can no longer perform in cities where mayors from the Front National party have been elected, and said about that: "That does not surprise me. Listen, next time we'll throw them all together in the oven. " The accusation is clearly not related to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament, but relates exclusively to national or regional action.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing. - The report concerns the request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity to MEP Jean-François Jalkh, following a lawsuit concerning an alleged offense of incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or group of people because of their origin or their belonging or not to a specific ethnicity, nation, race or religion, punishable by French law. The complaint concerns statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen about the singer Patrick Bruel, who had said he would not act in cities that elected a mayor of the National Front, where he said: “That doesn't surprise me. Listen, there will be a batch next time ». Jean-François Jalkh was director of publications on the official website of the National Front that disseminated these statements. He was not, at the time, a member of the European Parliament. The charges are not related to the exercise of these functions. They refer to activities of a purely national or regional nature, namely local elections and his position as director of publications of the National Front. There is nothing to suspect the existence of an attempt to obstruct Jean-François Jalkh's parliamentary work behind the judicial inquiry launched following the complaint. We voted in favor.

name: Julia REID
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted to waive the immunity because at the time that the alleged offences took place he was not a sitting MEP.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing.- The alleged actions do not concern opinions or votes expressed by the MEP in the exercise of his duties.The European Parliament decides to waive the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: written.- I voted in favor of suspending the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, in view of the report prepared by the Legal Affairs Committee, which states that the prosecutor of the Paris Court of Appeal has requested such suspension in relation to an alleged crime ofincitement to discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or a group of people on the grounds of their origin or of their belonging to an ethnic group, a nation, a race or a specific religion, a crime classified under French law,when Jean-François Jalkh had not assumed his duties as a Member of the European Parliament and having found that the charges were not manifestly related to his status as a Member of the European Parliament.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of lifting the immunity of Mr. Jean-François Jalkh, so that the French justice can carry out its work, in strict compliance with the rights of the defense, it being understood that the statements in question (comments made byJean-Marie Le Pen and relayed on the websites of the National Front) have no direct link with the function of MEP of Mr. Jalkh.They are linked to his position as director of publications for the Front National, responsible for the editorial control of all the federation's websites, and are therefore not motivated by any desire to harm his function as MEP.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: in writing.- Any accusation by a law enforcement official against a Member of the European Parliament must be taken seriously.We cannot allow the mandate of a Member of the European Parliament to become an opportunity to evade responsibility.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of parliamentary immunity to François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France as responsible for the publication of clearly Nazi-fascist statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen.Jean-François Jalkh was the director of the official website of the Front National, which published statements by Le Pen, which precisely also led to the suspension of his parliamentary immunity.Taking into account that these events have nothing to do with his parliamentary work, but are nothing more than an expression of his deplorable far-right position, I have voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his complicity and promotion of incitementto racism and hatred.

name: Jill SEYMOUR
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this as the offence took place before he was an MEP.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing - Request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh by the French Minister for Justice and Freedom in connection with a judicial inquiry against him in the Paris District Court following a joint submission by the National Anti-Semitism Supervision Office for public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence.I supported the motion for a resolution on the waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh, as it is necessary for the Paris District Court to examine whether an MEP has committed a criminal offense which is unrelated to his term of office as an MEP but relates to activitiesnational and regional in nature, as they were related to the municipal elections in March 2014 and to his role as director of publishing activities of the National Front, who exercised editorial control over the movement's website.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: in writing. - The Public Prosecutor of the Court of Appeal in Paris requests the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, Member of the European Parliament, in connection with the trial for the alleged crime. The request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh is related to the alleged crime of public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or group of persons because of their origin or belonging to or belonging to a particular ethnic group, nationality, race or religion. The complaint concerns statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen in an interview published on June 6, 2014 on frontnational.com and on the blog jeanmarielepen.com, where he is in response to a question from the audience about singer Patrick Bruel, who said that can no longer perform in cities where mayors have been elected from the National Front, she said: “This does not surprise me. Listen, next time we'll put them all in the oven. ”During that period, Jean-François Jalkh was the head of publications for the official website of the National Front. As a Member of the European Parliament enjoys immunity in the territory of his country and therefore no legal proceedings or investigation may be ordered against him, I believe that it is appropriate to waive his immunity. That is why I voted in favor of the report and thus also in favor of waiving the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: in writing. - Jean-François Jalkh was waived his immunity in connection with a judicial inquiry into public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence.Jean-François Jalkh, as director of publishing activities on the official website of the National Front, published Jean-Marie Le Pen's anti-Semitic statements.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: written.- Jean-François Jalkh is charged in connection with a lawsuit filed by the Bureau national de vigilance contre l'antisémitisme on 12 August 2014 with the competent prosecutor in Paris.The indictment relates to statements made during an interview published on the "frontnational.com" website and then on the "jeanmarielepen.com" blog.The accusation is clearly not related to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament, but only to national or regional action.I support the report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, as the alleged acts do not involve the expression of opinion or the vote of Members of the European Parliament.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: in writing.The waiver of immunity should cover only acts falling within the scope of parliamentary duties.In this report, the facts described in the documentation of the accusations have nothing to do with real crimes but only with malicious lawsuits from political opponents, in order to damage the prestige of the MEP and to hinder his work.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: in writing.- I voted positively on the request for the waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh so that he can defend himself before the courts of his country.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh, who faces two cases of litigation. The first case relates an offence of public incitement of discrimination, hatred and violence, by where Mr. Jalkh, the publishing editor of the National Front´s website, posted the interview by where Jean-Marie Le Pen suggested to “put them all in the oven together next time”, when referencing the Jewish people. The second case relates public incitement to discrimination, based on statements Jalkh published in the National Front’s “Handbook for Front National local councillors”, encouraging FN candidates, if elected, to give priority to French people when allocating social housing. As both charges are unrelated to Mr. Jalkh’s work in the EP and do not reflect the opinions of a Member of the EP, I believe that his immunity should be waived.

name: Ivica TOLIĆ
text: written.- I support the "Motion for a resolution on the request to lift the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalka".Because Jean-François Jalkh is charged in a lawsuit filed by the Maison des potes - Maison de l'égalité with the Nanterre Regional Court on 22 May 2014, for the criminal offense of public incitement to discrimination based on nationality, race or religionaffiliation according to Article 131. 2., 3.of the French Criminal Code allegedly committed on 19 September 2013.At the time of the alleged commission of the offense, the accused was not a Member of the European Parliament.Immunity in the European Parliament protects Members from offenses that are directly and obviously related to the performance of their duties.Given that Jean-Francois Jalku's alleged offense is not directly linked to his duty and that it was not possibly committed at all during his term, I consider that the request for the waiver of immunity is justified.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: written. - Jean-François Jalkh, Member of the European Parliament, has been prosecuted for allegedly inciting discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or group of persons on the grounds of origin or belonging to or belonging to a particular ethnic group, nation, race or religion. Bureau national de vigilance contre l'antisémitisme (National Office for the Suppression of Anti-Semitism) on 12 August 2014. In 2014, an interview with Jean-Marie Le Pen was published. In that interview, Le Pen referred to the statement of singer Patrick Bruel that he can no longer perform in cities where mayors have been elected from the Front National party. Le Pen said: "That does not surprise me. Listen, next time we're going to throw them all together in the oven. As Jean-François Jalkh had not yet taken up his duties as a Member of the European Parliament, the accusation was not linked to his position as Member of Parliament but to national or regional activities and his position as Director of Publications in the Party. immunity.

name: Romana TOMC
text: in writing.- I supported the proposal for a European Parliament decision on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-Francois Jalkh.The Public Prosecutor of the Court of Appeal in Versailles is requesting the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of Jean-François Jalkh, Member of the European Parliament, in connection with the trial for the alleged crime.He was not yet a Member of the European Parliament during this period, so this activity is of a regional-local nature.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: in writing. - This request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity arises from a fumus persecutionis, perfume of persecution for the following cumulative reasons: the fact that the present request for the lifting of Mr Jalkh's immunity was signed on the same day (April 14, 2016 ) by the French Minister of Justice for two cases involving the same parliamentarian when these cases relate to events occurring at different times; the fact that the Paris prosecutor is motivating his request for the lifting of Mr. Jalkh's parliamentary immunity by the need to issue a warrant. This request is totally disproportionate since Mr. Jalkh has never said he wanted to evade a summons from the investigating judge if his immunity was waived. A simple summons or a simple summons to appear would have sufficed. This request is above all totally contrary to the fundamental democratic principle of equality of litigants before the law, since the request for the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of the main author of the incriminated remarks, Mr. Jean-Marie Le Pen, is not at all justified, it, by the need to issue a warrant. There are therefore double standards. I obviously give my full support to my colleague Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Kazimierz Michał UJAZDOWSKI
text: in writing.- The request of the French prosecutor's office to waive the parliamentary immunity of Mr Jalkh is related to the court proceedings on public incitement to racial hatred in the film "Interview with Jean-Marie Le Pen", which was published on the official website of the National Front and on a blog.It is obvious that the alleged offense is clearly linked to the function of a member of the European Parliament and results from his performance as a member of the National Front Council.I voted in favor of the request for the waiver of immunity.

name: István UJHELYI
text: in writing.- Request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh in connection with the alleged offense against a person or group of persons of the offense of public incitement to discriminate, hatred or violence based on origin or belonging to a particular ethnic group, nation, race or religion,in law.I followed the group's position with my vote.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the request for the suspension of immunity as proposed by the JURI committee.I understand that there is no possibility of using the suspension to initiate a political persecution.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒  I voted in favour of the Report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh. The waiver of immunity of Jean-François Jalkh relates to an alleged offence of incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence in respect of a person or group of persons on account of their origin or membership or non-membership of a particular ethnic group, nation, race or religion. Jean-François Jalkh was accused by the Association ‘National Office for Vigilance against Anti-Semitism (BNVCA)’ in an application lodged with the Senior Examining Magistrate in Paris on 12 August 2014. I voted in favour because Jean-François Jalkh had not assumed his duties as a Member of the European Parliament when the alleged offence took place and that these charges are manifestly unrelated to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament. Moreover, the alleged actions do not relate to opinions expressed or votes cast by the Member of the European Parliament in the performance of his duties and there is no suspicion of any attempt to obstruct the parliamentary work of Jean-François Jalkh behind the judicial inquiry.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the suspension of parliamentary immunity to François Jalkh, since he has been denounced in France as responsible for the publication of clearly Nazi-fascist statements by Jean-Marie Le Pen.Jean-François Jalkh was the director of the official website of the Front National, which published statements by Le Pen, which precisely also led to the suspension of his parliamentary immunity.Taking into account that these events have nothing to do with his parliamentary work, but are nothing more than an expression of his deplorable ultra-rightist position, I have voted in favor of lifting his parliamentary immunity so that he can be tried for his complicity and promotion of incitementto racism and hatred.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: written.- I voted in favor because the allegations are apparently unrelated to Jean-François Jalkh's position as a Member of the European Parliament and rather concern activities in the purely national or regional sphere.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing.- The accusations are manifestly unrelated to the post of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament and relate to activities of a purely national or regional nature, given that the statements refer to the local elections held on 23 and 30 March2014, and his post as director of publications of the National Front with editorial control over all the federation's Internet sites.The alleged actions do not concern opinions or votes expressed by the MEP in the exercise of his duties.There is nothing to suspect the existence of an attempt to obstruct Jean-François Jalkh's parliamentary work behind the judicial inquiry launched following the complaint.We therefore approved the survey.

name: Milan ZVER
text: in writing.- The request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh is linked to the alleged crime of public incitement to discrimination, hatred or violence against a person or group of persons because of their origin or belonging to or belonging to a particular ethnic group, nationality, race or religion.Whereas the allegations are manifestly unrelated to the position of Jean-François Jalkh as a Member of the European Parliament and do not relate to the opinion or vote which that Member would have expressed in the performance of his duties as a Member of the European Parliament within the meaning of Article 8 of Protocol No.7 on the Privileges and Immunities of the European Union, I voted in favor of the Report on the request for waiver of the immunity of Jean-François Jalkh.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: written. - I voted in favor of this new cod plan, since it simplifies the landing of catches and updates the 2008 one, burdened by the limitation of fishing effort that reduced the time that sailors could fish. With the application of the discard veto, this limit was turned into an unnecessary tool. Adapted the proposal to the new Common Fisheries Policy, this new Regulation therefore introduces a provision that obliges the Council to set the Total Allowable Catch (TAC) based on the maximum sustainable yield (MSY) and establishes that in setting the quotas in cases of insufficient data the precautionary approach must prevail. This update of the management plan for cod and the fisheries that exploit it is necessary, although it is expected to have a short life until the approval of the multi-year North Sea Plan. All this does not prevent it from prudently accepting the impact that the landing obligation may have on the sustainability of the fishing fleets that exploit them.

name: Eric ANDRIEU
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this text, in particular to provide better legal certainty for Union fishermen.The Court of Justice of the European Communities has supported the European Parliament in declaring that the multiannual fisheries management plans, taken as a whole, constitute political choices which should be decided within the framework of the ordinary legislative process, in accordance with Article 43,paragraph 2 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, which is the legal basis of the Treaty of Lisbon for measures which pursue the objectives of common policies in the field of agriculture and fisheries.Following this judgment, our Socialist Group made a constructive contribution to the rapid development of a revised cod plan which fully complies with the principles of the reformed CFP and can enter into force on 1 January 2017.

name: Laima Liucija ANDRIKIENĖ
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on cod stocks and the multiannual plan for fisheries exploiting those stocks.Importantly, this agreement, which implements the principles of the new Common Fisheries Policy and supports its development, will improve the 2012 budget.regulations.I supported this report, agreeing that a balance must be struck not only between meeting the needs of the fishing industry and consumers, but also about protecting cod stocks and establishing sustainable fishing.

name: Nikos ANDROULAKIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the recommendation at second reading on the position of the Council at first reading with a view to the adoption of a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation No.Council Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fishing activities that exploit these stocks, because I believe that it implements the principles of the new Common Fisheries Policy.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing.- Council Regulation No. 1342/2008 of 18 December 2008 was adopted before the entry into force of the TFEU and therefore confers decision-making powers on the Council (Articles 10 and 11).As the TFEU no longer allows this possibility, the Commission has therefore suggested an amendment to this regulation.The main purpose of the proposal is to improve and clarify the provisions of the Regulation.It implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy and supports its application.Basically, the old 2008 plan contained a complicated system of fishing effort (days at sea) which failed to restore the stocks.I therefore voted in favor of this report.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ This matter was approved without a vote at second reading.
