Whilst I support a long-term plan for cod stocks (and indeed, for Britain regaining our 200-mile limit on leaving the EU), I also believe that the Common Fisheries Policy is woefully inadequate for achieving that. Had there been a vote, it is highly likely that I would have voted against.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing.- - I voted in favor of the report on cod stocks and the multiannual plan for fisheries exploiting those stocks.In the current situation, the control of fishing activities and the penalties for infringements vary greatly between EU countries, and the same infringement can be subject to an administrative penalty or a criminal sanction.I therefore agree with the need to harmonize controls on fishing activities and penalties for infringements.Also establish a uniform training program for inspectors.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- Council Regulation No. 1342/2008 of 18 December 2008 was adopted before the entry into force of the TFEU and therefore confers decision-making powers on the Council (Articles 10 and 11).As the TFEU no longer allows this possibility, the Commission has therefore suggested an amendment to this regulation.I therefore voted in favor of this proposal, which essentially aims to improve and clarify the provisions of the 2008 regulation, which seems to me to be a step in the right direction, both for the preservation of cod stocks and for the fisheries exploiting these stocks.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- I approved this report which underlines in particular the usefulness of measures other than the reduction of the admissible catch rates and the adjustment of the fishing effort to achieve the objectives set in the long-term plan for the management ofcod.Thus, Member States should also prioritize the development and promotion of measures and incentives to avoid unwanted catches.Financial support should also be granted for the use of suitable selective measures.

name: Beatriz BECERRA BASTERRECHEA
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report because there is a lot of scientific evidence that the four cod stocks in Europe are at much lower than sustainable levels.The stricter standards that were established in 2004 (revised in 2008) have turned out to be insufficient.Pending the adoption of the mixed fisheries management plan for the North Sea, this Regulation represents an interim solution.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of the Dodds report on establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries that exploit those stocks. This is an important text that updates Regulation (EC) No. 1342/2008 in order to improve and clarify some of the provisions contained therein. The scientific evaluation of the current legislative text, in fact, has shown the presence of some problems, in particular as regards the strategy for managing stocks in the North Sea. The changes approved today will make the regulation compatible with the new common fisheries policy, establishing the landing obligation and banning the practice of discards. With the new measures it will be possible to have more precise data on real catches and thus ensure better planning. The goal of the long-term plan is precisely to keep cod stocks above levels capable of producing the maximum sustainable yield, thus favoring fishing that is profitable for the fishermen and sustainable for the ecosystem.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report because I understand that it is an adjustment and adaptation of regulations.An introduction of delegated acts is carried out in the following areas: adaptation of fishing mortality rates and associated levels of stock biomass to scientific discoveries, adjustment of fishing effort in the event of exclusion or re-entry of a group of vessels under the regimeof effort, specification of the rules on the method of calculating fishing capacity and the adaptation of maximum capacity levels and, finally, the establishment of rules on a calculation method that allows Member States to adjust the maximum fishing effortadmissible in relation to quota management and after effort transfers.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I want to thank Mrs Doods for her work on this report on the Long Term Plan for Cod Stocks and the Fisheries that Exploit them.I have supported this report, which comes from the last legislature, as we have had to adapt it not only to the Lisbon Treaty but also to the reform of the common fisheries policy.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing.- I vote in favor of the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting these stocks, amending Council Regulation No 1342/2008 of 18 December 2008. The principles of the new fisheries policy appear to us to be such as topreserve marine biodiversity.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- There are some significant critical issues in the text that convinced me not to support this new long-term plan for cod stocks.We need other measures to relaunch fishing, to give jobs back to our fishermen and operators throughout the fishing sector, who expect fewer obstacles and more support from the Union.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written. - Report subject to complaint before the Court of Justice of the EU (CJEU). The Parliament adopted its position at first reading on June 11, 2013, pending the outcome of the CJEU ruling that on December 1, 2015 made it clear that fisheries management plans fall under the ordinary legislative procedure ex Article 43 (2) TFEU . The ruling annulled Council Regulation (EU) No. 1243/2012, which amended provisions of the Plan in articles 9 and 12 to establish fishing opportunities in situations in which the data was insufficient to establish the status of stocks, and maintained the effects of the annulled Regulation for an additional year so that the new Regulation could be adopted on the correct legal basis during that period of time. Thus, the co-legislators adopted a text through the ordinary legislative procedure within the established period to ensure legal certainty and a compromise agreement was reached in the first and only trilogue of June 29, 2016. The revised Plan is completely online. with the principles of the CFP and, to ensure legal certainty to the fishing sector, it will enter into force on January 1, 2017. I voted in favor of the report.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report as it approved Parliament 's regulation amending Council Regulation (EC) No.Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a multiannual plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks.This regulation has been the subject of an interinstitutional dispute before the European Court of Justice since 2013, as the Council exceeded its powers and failed to take into account the Commission's 2012 report.proposal approved by the European Parliament.With this report from Parliament, we have endorsed a text for a regulation that is in line with European Union law and the position of all the institutions in accordance with their powers.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: in writing. - I would like to draw attention to the fact that 30% of the Earth's seas are overfished, subject to significant environmental pressures from a number of sources, which has put marine fish stocks at risk. It is understandable that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is forced to restrict sea fishing accordingly. Therefore, the Common Fisheries Policy must pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, ie aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant part of the fishponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 areas. These fish farms do not pose any threat to the natural values ​​of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is due to our closed system of fishponds that the unique wetland associations they have created or preserved are. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture must be given priority and as much EU support as possible. In view of the above, I supported the adoption of the report.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: in writing.- I supported this recommendation, as it is an endangered fish species, which is on the list mainly due to overfishing.It is important to be aware of the problem of overfishing of certain fish species and to protect them for our offspring.

name: Biljana BORZAN
text: written.- I support this Report, which, after a long dispute over the EP's powers as a legislator in the field of fisheries policy and a positive judgment of the European Court, constructively contributes to the rapid drafting of an amended plan that is fully in line with the reformed CFP principles.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing.- Regulation No. 1342/2008 of December 18, 2008, which was adopted before the entry into force of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU), confers decision-making powers on the European Council.Given that the TFEU no longer allows this possibility, the European Commission wished to suggest a modification of this regulation.This essentially aims to clarify the provisions of the regulation and aims to implement the principles of the new common fisheries policy.I voted in favor of this modification of the directive, which should help to rebuild cod stocks.

name: Alain CADEC
text: in writing.- This report strengthens cooperation between scientists and fishermen for the management of cod stocks and allows a modification of the calculation of the effort to limit fishing pressure.The precise list of fishing gear authorized for the capture of cod simplifies the legislation.The gradual landing obligation as adopted in the reform of the common fisheries policy now applies to cod.In order to achieve the maximum sustainable yield, a range of fishing mortality values allowed to bring cod stocks to the maximum sustainable yield is established.I welcome the adoption of this report in codecision following an interinstitutional conflict which has made it possible to strengthen Parliament's powers as legislator.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. - Today we approved the new regulation for cod stocks which is in line with the reform of the Common Fisheries Policy, in particular in terms of definitions and objectives. The rules currently governing the definition of annual catch limits by the Council would be replaced with this new regulation by the obligation to respect the precautionary principle, together with a system of fishing authorizations and ceilings on fishing capacity. It seems to me an excellent result and a step in the right direction. In 2012, the Council adopted on its own initiative, bypassing the European Parliament, several measures to amend the fisheries management plan in relation to numerous cod stocks in European seas. This regulation, promulgated only by the Council, was annulled by the European Court of Justice. Today we finally have a new regulation, based on the appropriate legal basis of 'codecision', which allows us to adjust the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries that exploit those stocks.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. – I voted in favour of an agreement reached with the Council position at first reading with a view to the adoption of a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Council Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing.- An agreement was reached between Parliament, Commission and Council in June 2016 to amend the 2008 regulation establishing a long-term management plan for cod stocks and the new rules will enter into force on 10 January 2017. TheThe plan identified is in line with the reform of the Common Fisheries Policy (CFP) and includes the obligation to respect a precautionary approach, as well as a system of fishing authorizations and capacity limits.I therefore voted in favor of its adoption.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: in writing.- We support the agreement, as it implements the principles of the new Common Fisheries Policy and supports its implementation.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: in writing.- We voted on the recommendation to amend Regulation no.Council Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fishing activities exploiting those stocks.I believe that this is a positive process that aims to streamline fishing and trade practices, with results that work in favor of the economy and the environment.That is why I voted in favor.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing.- I approve of the long-term plan since I believe it is essential to implement the principles of the new common fisheries policy and support its application, in order not to witness the misalignments that have arisen on the market due to the application of unequal national regulationsand tendentious, in addition to the frequent damage generated to biodiversity and the ecosystem due to lack of controls.I hope that this orientation in the North Sea will continue in the most complete representation.However, I would like to remind you how often with regard to fish policies the growing and erroneous competition that the Mediterranean countries have to face from non-European countries, where fishing is sinister, uncontrolled and certainly not in line with the envisaged health regulations, is overlooked.A greater interest, however, should be paid in this regard.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the provision approving the early second reading agreement reached between Parliament and the Council in June 2016. The draft regulation breaks the complicated fisheries regime currently in place since 2008 which has failed to improve the stateof cod stocks in the North Sea.The changes introduced which take into account, among other things, the introduction of the landing obligation in the areas of the plan and which guarantee greater flexibility in the definition of catches (TACs) and total allowable quotas are in my opinion improving the situation.current.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ According to this report, it has been verified that all the procedures have been duly completed, and, in agreement with the Secretary-General of the Council it calls to arrange for its publication. I take note that after an ECJ judgement, the PECH Committee adopted a mandate for the negotiations with the Council in April and the file was concluded in a single trilogue in June. The agreement implements principles of the new Common Fisheries Policy and supports its implementation. Given that this agreement was accepted by the PECH Committee on in July I see no reason to object to it.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written. ‒I have voted in favor of this new cod plan, since it simplifies the landing of catches and updates the 2008 plan, burdened by the limitation of fishing effort that reduced the time that sailors could fish. With the application of the discard veto, this limit was turned into an unnecessary tool. Adapted the proposal to the new Common Fisheries Policy, this new Regulation therefore introduces a provision that obliges the Council to set the Total Allowable Catch (TAC) based on the maximum sustainable yield (MSY) and establishes that in setting the quotas in cases of insufficient data the precautionary approach must prevail. This update of the management plan for cod and the fisheries that exploit it is necessary, although it is expected to have a short life until the approval of the multi-year North Sea Plan. All this does not prevent it from prudently accepting the impact that the landing obligation may have on the sustainability of the fishing fleets that exploit them.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this resolution to support the Council's position on amending the regulation on the long-term plan for fisheries exploiting cod stocks.In fact, I believe that the amendment of Regulation (EC) no.1342/2008, in order to improve and clarify its provisions, is of fundamental importance to ensure the implementation of a sustainable plan for fishing and cod fishing activities, in line with the principles of the new common fisheries policy.Furthermore, this is an important achievement for the European Parliament which, as confirmed by the opinion of the Court of Justice, has legislative power over fisheries policies under the ordinary legislative procedure.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and fisheries. The report by the Scientific, Technical and Economic Committee for Fisheries (STECF) on the evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of Council Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 of 18 December 2008 has identified numerous irregularities and shortcomings in this respect. The STECF report, which was drawn up three years after the adoption of the regulation, concluded that the objectives of the cod plan had not been achieved and are unlikely to be achieved by 2015. The Committee, the Regional Advisory Councils and the Member States propose a revision of this regulation. I believe that it is necessary to take measures, the new directions of change will increase the effectiveness of the recovery of cod stocks in the northern waters of the EU, but also lead to the clarification and simplification of procedures in favor of the industry, while taking into account the socio-economic impact.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ In 2012, the Council decided on a number of measures amending a fisheries management plan covering several stocks of cod in European seas. This Council-only regulation was annulled by the Court of Justice.  I am in favour of this report as it calls for the need to adopt a new regulation founded on the codecision legal basis to ensure an effective fisheries management plan. The report also notes that in order to ensure a fair and sustainable fishing industry, we must ensure that the fishing community has legal certainty and that a long-term plan for cod stock which is fully in line with the principles of the reformed common fisheries policy is implemented.

name: Daniel DALTON
text: in writing. ‒ I was pleased to vote to secure the future for cod fishermen. This amendment cleans up the previous regulation, with all references to precautionary spawning biomass levels being deleted. All the previous provisions relating to effort regime, which have been seen as an obstacle to the implementation of the landing obligation, have also been deleted.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: in writing.- This report concerns the proposal for a new regulation amending the long-term plan for cod stocks of 2008, amendment presented by the European Commission in September 2012. The objective of this proposal is to adapt the rules in force insetting limits on allowable catches (TACs) applicable to stocks for which there is insufficient information, and strengthening measures relating to discards.Considering that, in a reflection of the rational use of natural resources, it is necessary to limit as much as possible the system of discharges, I supported this report.

name: Rachida DATI
text: in writing.- It is up to the European Union to ensure both the profitability of the fishing sector while ensuring the reproductive capacities of the stocks.The previous regulation on the management of cod stocks proved to be unsuitable for European objectives of sustainable exploitation of stocks.I therefore supported the amendment of this regulation in order to align the management plan for cod stocks with the requirements of the basic regulation on the common fisheries policy.This new regulation simplifies the rules concerning fishing possibilities and puts an end to the fishing effort management regime which prevented the correct application of measures against accidental catches.

name: Andor DELI
text: in writing. - In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I, along with my Fidesz colleagues, supported the adoption without a vote of the Dodds report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. This step approved the legislative text finalized in the second reading agreement between the EP and the Council. New legislation is needed as the old fishing plan used a complex catch system. In practice, this has led to a deterioration of the cod stock. The new rules are more flexible in terms of TACs and fishing quotas and streamline the rules on landing obligations. Progress has also been made in tightening discards for unusable fish. 30% of the Earth's seas are overfished, and marine fish stocks are at risk. It is therefore understandable that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is forced to restrict sea fishing accordingly. Therefore, the Common Fisheries Policy must pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, ie aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant part of the fishponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 areas. These fish farms do not pose any threat to the natural values ​​of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is due to our closed system of fishponds that the unique wetland associations they have created or preserved are. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture must be given priority and as much EU support as possible.

name: Gérard DEPREZ
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this resolution to amend Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 to make it easier for cod fishermen in the North Sea to land all their catches - and not just cod.From 1 January 2017, the limits that apply to the number of days a vessel can spend in a fishing area will now be removed and all obstacles related to full compliance with the landing obligation will be removed.It should be noted, however, that new multi-year plans for multi-species fisheries in various regions of the Atlantic are being developed.The current regulation will therefore continue to apply, but only until the entry into force of the new multiannual plans for multi-species fisheries.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: in writing.- I voted for this report.The proposal essentially aims to improve and clarify the provisions of Regulation 1342/2008 of 18 December 2008 by implementing the new common fisheries policy, taking note of the fact that the old system did not allow the stocks to be restored.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: in writing.- Positive vote.A common fisheries policy will protect marine fauna and flora.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: in writing. - In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I, along with my Fidesz colleagues, supported the adoption without a vote of the Dodds report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. This step approved the legislative text finalized in the second reading agreement between the EP and the Council. New legislation is needed as the old fishing plan used a complex catch system. In practice, this has led to a deterioration of the cod stock. The new rules are more flexible in terms of TACs and fishing quotas and streamline the rules on landing obligations. Progress has also been made in tightening discards for unusable fish. 30% of the Earth's seas are overfished, and marine fish stocks are at risk. It is therefore understandable that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is forced to restrict sea fishing accordingly. Therefore, the Common Fisheries Policy must pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, ie aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant part of the fishponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 areas. These fish farms do not pose any threat to the natural values ​​of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is due to our closed system of fishponds that the unique wetland associations they have created or preserved are. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture must be given priority and as much EU support as possible.

name: Jill EVANS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as is it vital that we secure the future of our fisheries. When Wales is outside of the EU we will be responsible for our own fisheries policy and it is vital that it is sustainable.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: in writing.- Vote in favor: the proposal mainly aims to improve and clarify the provisions of the regulation.Basically, the old 2008 plan contained a complicated system of fishing effort (days at sea) which failed to restore the stocks.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - This proposal for a Regulation has been pending since the previous parliamentary term, due to its referral to the EU Court of Justice, by disagreement between the European Parliament and the Council, on competences in relation to multiannual plans. The European Commission's original proposal foresaw the introduction of delegated acts in the following areas: adaptation of fishing mortality rates and associated biomass levels of the stock to scientific discoveries; adjustment of fishing effort in case of exclusion or re-inclusion of a group of vessels in the effort regime; specification of rules concerning the method of calculating fishing capacity and adjusting maximum capacity levels; and establishment of rules on the method of calculation that allows Member States to adapt the maximum authorized fishing effort in relation to quota management and following effort transfers between effort groups. The report, broadly in line with the Commission's proposal, nevertheless proposes a stricter definition of the circumstances in which the Commission can approve delegated acts, which is considered positive. It should be noted, however, that this document will be replaced by a Multispecies Plan for the region where it is applied, which will merit further and more in-depth reflection.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fishing activities that exploit these stocks.A common fisheries policy will protect marine fauna and flora.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ The act is adopted in accordance with the Council position. I support the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks.

name: Kinga GÁL
text: in writing.- In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I, together with my Fidesz Members, supported the adoption of the Dodds report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks.This step approved the legislative text finalized in the second reading agreement between the EP and the Council.The new rules are more flexible in terms of TACs and fishing quotas and streamline the rules on landing obligations, which is why I supported the adoption of the report.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the recommendation for second reading on the Council's position at first reading with a view to adopting the Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EC) No. 1342/2008 of the Council establishing a long-term plan for the cod stocks and the fisheries that exploit these stocks, as this is a necessary and long overdue intervention. The dossier relating to the amendment of Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 has in fact been at a standstill for almost 4 years due to the institutional clash that has seen the Commission, Parliament and Council challenge each other before the Court of Justice on the applicable legislative procedure. This conflict has in fact paralyzed a process of adapting EU legislation which is absolutely necessary given the reform of the common fisheries policy and the recent introduction of the landing obligation and the rules on unwanted catches. I therefore find it important that, while waiting for the Member States to define their multiannual plans for multi-species fisheries, the current regulation is amended in order to ensure the survival of cod fish stocks and provide legal certainty for European fishermen.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- As a member of the European Parliament for the Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania coastal region, the preservation of maritime biodiversity is an honest concern of mine.That is why I voted in favor of the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries which fish for those stocks.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ President, I voted in favour of this report given there is need to amend the current plan governing long term stocks, which are not doing enough to ensure recovery of fish mortality, and have little stakeholder support. I welcome that the amendments will increase cooperation between fisheries, industries and scientists.

name: Michela GIUFFRIDA
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report because there is no doubt that the need to protect fish stocks must be very carefully combined with the need for flexibility. It is difficult to explain why it is Brussels that determines the size of the nets, the size of the clams, the quantity of the catch. There are sectors, I am thinking of fishing but also agriculture, in which the link between worker and resource goes far beyond the profession. The fisherman with the sea, the farmer with the land: these are relationships that have unwritten rules that have little to do with the Brussels regulations. In the largest fishing production district in my region - Mazara del Vallo - deep sea fishing boats have collapsed from 400 to 80. Fishing in a border area makes it even clearer to fishermen how the European fisheries policy is strong with the countries members and weak with foreign ones. With these rules and these production costs, our fish can never be as competitive as the Libyan, Egyptian, Tunisian, not to mention the Filipino one. In the evaluation of the fisheries policy there should also be these numbers, those that make citizens' trust collapse from the European dream.

name: Sylvie GODDYN
text: in writing. - I voted for this resolution on the cod stocks plan. Provisionally applied, this plan will eventually be replaced by multi-annual plans for mixed fisheries (that is to say fisheries where several species are caught) in all the areas concerned. Pending these regionalized plans, the modifications made to the “cod” plan simplify its application while guaranteeing better stock management. Thus, cod fishermen will no longer be subject to time limits (days at sea) which have made it impossible to restore stocks. They will be able to land all their catches, even unwanted ones, instead of throwing a part of it at sea. Other modifications are made which will make it possible to avoid disparities in the calculations of fishing effort by the Member States (which lead some states to fish more than the plan allows). It also alleviates the administrative burden on fishermen by abolishing procedures relating to fishing activities in which insignificant quantities of cod are caught. Similarly, it exempts from the fishing effort management regime vessels participating in trials involving fully documented fisheries.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report because I understand that it is an adjustment and adaptation of regulations.An introduction of delegated acts is carried out in the following areas: adaptation of fishing mortality rates and associated levels of stock biomass to scientific discoveries, adjustment of fishing effort in the event of exclusion or re-entry of a group of vessels under the regimeof effort, specification of the rules on the method of calculating fishing capacity and the adaptation of maximum capacity levels and, finally, the establishment of rules on a calculation method that allows Member States to adjust the maximum fishing effortadmissible in relation to quota management and after effort transfers.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as it amends  the current plan governing long term stocks, which were not doing enough to ensure recovery of fish mortality and had little stakeholder support. This report will increase cooperation between fisheries, industries and scientists.

name: András GYÜRK
text: in writing. - I supported the adoption without a vote of the Dodds report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. This step approved the legislation finalized in the second reading agreement between Parliament and Council. New legislation is needed, as the old fishing plan used a complex catch system, which in practice led to a deterioration of cod stocks. The new rules are more flexible in terms of TACs and fishing quotas and streamline the rules on landing obligations. Progress has also been made in tightening discards for unusable fish. 30% of the Earth's seas are overfished, and marine fish stocks are at risk. It is therefore understandable that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is forced to restrict sea fishing accordingly. The common fisheries policy must pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, that is, aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant part of the fishponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 areas. These fish farms do not pose any threat to the natural values ​​of these areas. Moreover, in many cases, due to the closed system of fishponds, the unique wetland association they created and preserved. Overall, therefore, freshwater aquaculture should be given priority and as much EU support as possible.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: in writing.- On 12 September 2012, the Commission presented a proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation No.1342/2008 (COM (2012) 0498 final), with the aim of improving and clarifying the provisions of Regulation (EC) No.Council Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fishing activities exploiting those stocks.We voted in favor, as the agreement is compatible with the principles of the new Common Fisheries Policy.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ Following serious depletion of four of Europe’s cod stocks to well below sustainable levels by the early 2000s, the EU imposed stringent rules on the industry through the first cod recovery plan in 2004 (revised in 2008; Regulation 1342/2008). The scientific evaluation report on the performance of the 2008 cod plan concluded the plan had not achieved its objectives. The aim of the proposal was to amend the existing Regulation of 2008 for a long-term plan for cod stocks. It suggested inter alia to: insert a certain flexibility into the rules on Total Allowable Catches; better harmonise the calculation of fishing effort; insert new and amended incentives into the system of fishing effort restrictions which aim at avoiding cod and reducing discards. I fully supported the aim of this proposal which was to amend the rules currently in force for cod stocks (a long-term plan, also known as the cod recovery plan, which has been in force since 2008). The agreed draft regulation discontinues the existing effort regime known as “days at sea” as it would have prevented the full application of the landing obligation (which is being phased in and will apply to all stocks by 2019) to the areas of the cod plan - thus granting more flexibility to fishermen.

name: Hans-Olaf HENKEL
text: in writing. ‒ In July 2016 agreement was reached on this proposal between Council and Parliament. Quick adoption of this regulation will ensure that there will be a simple and smooth transition of rules governing the sustainable exploitation of cod stocks above levels capable of producing maximum sustainable yield (MSY)* in the Kattegat, the North Sea, the Skagerrak and the eastern Channel, the west of Scotland and the Irish Sea as of 1 January 2017. This Regulation amends the existing 2008 Regulation to rebuild depleting cod stocks. The 2016 Cod Recovery Plan has been simplified and aligned with the aims and objectives of the reformed Common Fisheries Policy. The text has been amended and "cleaned up"- all provisions relating to effort regime have been deleted (effort regime was seen as being an obstacle to the implementation of the landing obligation) and precautionary spawning biomass levels have been deleted and will be included in the multi-annual fisheries management plans. I voted in favour.

name: György HÖLVÉNYI
text: in writing. - In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I, along with my Fidesz colleagues, supported the adoption without a vote of the Dodds report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. This step approved the legislative text finalized in the second reading agreement between the EP and the Council. New legislation is needed as the old fishing plan used a complex catch system. In practice, this has led to a deterioration of the cod stock. The new rules are more flexible in terms of TACs and fishing quotas and streamline the rules on landing obligations. Progress has also been made in tightening discards for unusable fish. 30% of the Earth's seas are overfished, and marine fish stocks are at risk. It is therefore understandable that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is forced to restrict sea fishing accordingly. Therefore, the Common Fisheries Policy must pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, ie aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant part of the fishponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 areas. These fish farms do not pose any threat to the natural values ​​of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is due to our closed system of fishponds that the unique wetland associations they have created or preserved are. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture must be given priority and as much EU support as possible.

name: Brice HORTEFEUX
text: in writing.- The adoption of the report on cod stocks takes into account the imperative need to ensure a future for future generations of fishermen.Thus, I am delighted that this report emphasizes cooperation between the scientific world and fishermen in order to improve the sustainable management of cod stocks.However, I call for full respect for the rules by fishermen of all nationalities because the unfair competition practiced by some is slowly killing the profession as a whole.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of this resolution establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and fisheries exploiting those stocks and implementing new principles of the Common Fisheries Policy.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the Council's position at first reading with a view to adopting a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending the regulation adopting a long-term plan for cod stocks and fisheries exploiting those stocks.I believe that it is necessary to fully implement the principle of the highest sustainable yield by establishing rules on fishing quotas and the obligation to timely unload cod stocks.I believe that maritime and fisheries policy should be based on sustainable measures and principles and in accordance with national and international provisions.That is why I support this recommendation.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Diane Dodds on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries that exploit them.This text aims to modify the fishing rules put in place by the cod plan of 2008. Thus, to give more flexibility to fishermen, it is planned that the fishing effort management regime will be abandoned and that the rules settingthe authorized catch limits are simplified.I approve of this initiative, which is in the direction of European fishermen, who today need our support more than ever.This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- I approved this report at second reading.It gives our fishermen more flexibility by modifying the effort regime for cod, the rules for setting allowable catches for poor stocks and protects the species and the environment by strengthening measures to combat discards.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report. The current plan governing long term stocks does need to be amended, which are not doing enough to ensure recovery of fish mortality, and have little stakeholder support. The fact that these amendments will increase cooperation between fisheries, industries and scientists is something I very much welcome.

name: Ádám KÓSA
text: in writing. - In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I, along with my Fidesz colleagues, supported the adoption without a vote of the Dodds report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. This step approved the legislative text finalized in the second reading agreement between the EP and the Council. New legislation is needed as the old fishing plan used a complex catch system. In practice, this has led to a deterioration of the cod stock. The new rules are more flexible in terms of TACs and fishing quotas and streamline the rules on landing obligations. Progress has also been made in tightening discards for unusable fish. 30% of the Earth's seas are overfished, and marine fish stocks are at risk. It is therefore understandable that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is forced to restrict sea fishing accordingly. Therefore, the Common Fisheries Policy must pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, ie aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant part of the fishponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 areas. These fish farms pose no threat to the natural values ​​of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is due to our closed system of fishponds that the unique wetland associations they have created or preserved are. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture must be given priority and as much EU support as possible.

name: Béla KOVÁCS
text: in writing.- Unfortunately, humanity has managed to pollute the seas to a great extent, but even so, with proper control, marine fish are a very important and healthy source of food for European consumers.Fishing can only be carried out within a regulated framework in order to conserve fish stocks, as provided for in the previous Council Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008, the updating of which will ensure that the biological balance of the North Sea is maintained.

name: Andrey KOVATCHEV
text: In written form. - I have expressed my support for the creation of a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries that exploit those stocks, as I believe that this is a crucial step in the effort to rebuild cod stocks in northern EU waters. The adopted plan aims to strengthen and expand cooperation between scientists in the field of fisheries and the sector. We are witnessing successful projects in a number of fisheries sectors related to cod. They aim to reduce cod catches and reduce discards while maintaining sustainable catch levels of the target species. This decision satisfies all stakeholders.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing.- The fishing regime which has been in place since 2008 must be discontinued because it has not been able to improve the North Sea cod stock.In April 2016, a mandate was adopted by the PECH committee for negotiations with the Council.This agreement, which implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy by supporting its application, was approved by the PECH commission itself in July 2016. It provided for the application of some changes aimed at introducing the landing obligation in the areas ofplan, ensuring greater flexibility in fishing methods and total allowable quotas.The new proposal will enter into force in January 2017 with validity until the adoption of the new multi-annual North Sea management plan, which was recently presented to the European Commission.For the above reasons, I vote in favor of the proposal.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: in writing.- I voted for the report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting these stocks.This Commission proposal mainly aims to improve and clarify the provisions of the 2008 regulation. It implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy and supports its application.Basically, the old plan contained a complicated system of fishing efforts (days at sea) which failed to restore stocks.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: in writing.- This proposal aims to improve and clarify the provisions of the current regulation, in force since 2008. It implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy and supports its application.Basically, the old plan contained a complicated system of fishing effort (days at sea), which failed to improve stocks.I readily support this improvement by voting for this report.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: written. - I voted in favor of this new cod plan, since it simplifies the landing of catches and updates the 2008 one, burdened by the limitation of fishing effort that reduced the time that sailors could fish. With the application of the discard veto, this limit was turned into an unnecessary tool. Adapted the proposal to the new Common Fisheries Policy, this new Regulation therefore introduces a provision that obliges the Council to set the Total Allowable Catch (TAC) based on the maximum sustainable yield (MSY) and establishes that in setting the quotas in cases of insufficient data the precautionary approach must prevail. This update of the management plan for cod and the fisheries that exploit it is necessary, although it is expected to have a short life until the approval of the multi-year North Sea Plan. All this does not prevent it from accepting with prudence the impact that the landing obligation may have on the sustainability of the fishing fleets that exploit them.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: written.- This draft legislative resolution approves the Council's position at first reading with a view to the adoption of a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending the Regulation on the establishment of a long-term plan for cod stocksand the fisheries that exploit them.After a lengthy dispute over codecision powers, Parliament approved the act, the purpose of which is to restore the number of cod stocks above the levels that allow maximum and lasting performance to be obtained.I am voting in favor because the amendment will be important to achieve the Union's objective of ensuring the sustainability of fisheries.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: in writing. ‒ The purpose of these amendments to establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks in the light of the evaluation of the plan carried out by the Scientific, Technical and Economic Committee for Fisheries.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: in writing.- I abstained from voting on the recommendation for second reading on the position of the Council at first reading with a view to the adoption of a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EC) No.Council Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and fishing activities exploiting these stocks, as it is incomplete and undocumented.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: in writing.- This text aims to clarify and simplify the provisions of Regulation No. 1342/2008 concerning the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting these stocks.It implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy and supports its application.The system introduced by the 2008 regulation was quite complicated, and did not allow cod stocks to be restored.The new regulation removes the limits that apply to the number of days a vessel could spend in a fishing zone, thereby removing all the obstacles associated with full compliance with the landing obligation.

name: Marisa MATIAS
text: in writing.- This report aims to regulate a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks, which generally supports the application of the principles of the new common fisheries policy and its implementation, providingEU countries more control at national and regional level.This policy aims to ensure that fishing is environmentally, economically and socially sustainable and that it is a source of healthy food for European citizens.Its aim is to promote a dynamic fisheries sector and guarantee a fair standard of living for fishing communities.I voted in favor.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor because this proposal seeks to improve and clarify the provisions of the Regulation to bring them into line with European Union law and the position of all institutions in accordance with their respective powers.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: in writing. - Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting these stocks provides that the impact of management measures must be assessed during the third year of application of the plan. The Scientific, Technical and Economic Committee for Fisheries (STECF) evaluated the plan in 2011. The STECF report indicated that the objectives of the cod management plan had not yet been met and that it was unlikely that they would be by 2015. It also revealed the existence of certain flaws in the design of the regulation as well as problems of implementation. The Commission proposes to amend the regulation taking into account these criticisms. In particular, it proposes to limit the scope of application in order to prevent the use of different calculation methods from leading to an increase in the fishing effect. The report supports the Commission proposal while adding a stricter definition of the circumstances under which the Commission can adopt delegated acts. I am voting for this text which protects both the cod resource and the prerogatives of the European Parliament.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: in writing.- This involves amending Council Regulation No. 1342/2008 of December 18, 2008, adopted prior to the entry into force of the European Union Functioning Treaty.This regulation confers decision-making powers on the Council.This modification aims to improve and clarify the provisions of the regulation relating in particular to the new common fisheries policy.I voted for this change to the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks since the previous plan contained a complicated system that failed to rebuild the stocks.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing.- It is very important to establish a long-term plan for the cod stocks and the fisheries that exploit those stocks.This is the only way to have an efficient management of maritime resources.Hence my vote in favor.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I approve of this long-term plan because it directs the Member States in determining the methods used to calculate annual fishing effort usages that will lead to better cod stock management and increase the stocks’ long-term sustainability.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: in writing.- I welcome the approval by the European Parliament of the amendment to the regulation on the creation of a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting these stocks.Now compliant with the new Common Fisheries Policy (CFP), the updated regulation will ensure compliance with the obligation to land all catches.In fact, by removing the provisions relating to the calculation of fishing effort, the new regulation puts an end to the incentives to discard catches into the sea and therefore allows fishermen to fully respect the prohibition of discarding as required by the policy.European Fisheries.This is therefore a further step towards the responsible and sustainable management of our fishery resources.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ In the long-standing dispute over the EP’s powers as co-legislator in the domain of fisheries policy, the European Court of Justice supported the EP, stating that multiannual fisheries management plans in their entirety make policy choices which should be decided under the ordinary legislative procedure, i.e. according to Article 43(2) TFEU, which is the legal basis in the Treaty of Lisbon for measures that are necessary for the pursuit of the objectives of the common agricultural and fisheries policies. The report calls on the swift elaboration of a revised cod plan that is fully in line with the principles of the reformed CFP and can enter in force by 1 January 2017 to ensure legal certainty for fishermen, which is essential. That is why I have voted in favour of this report

name: Bernard MONOT
text: in writing.- Council Regulation No. 1342/2008 of December 18, 2008 was adopted before the entry into force of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU) and therefore confers decision-making powers on the Council (Articles 10 and 11).As the TFEU no longer allows this possibility, the Commission has therefore suggested an amendment to this regulation.The main purpose of the proposal is to improve and clarify the provisions of the Regulation.It implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy and supports its application.Basically, the old 2008 plan contained a complicated system of fishing effort (days at sea) which did not allow the stocks to be restored.Favorable vote.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: in writing.- The proposal mainly aims to improve and clarify the provisions of the Regulation.It implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy and supports its application.Basically, the old 2008 plan contained a complicated system of fishing effort (days at sea) which did not allow the stocks to be restored.I vote for this text.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report as it will reduce burden on fisheries, and improve recovery for stocks.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: in writing.- This report concerned the long-term management plan for cod stocks.This was a second reading text for which no rejection amendment was tabled.It was therefore approved without a vote.

name: Alessandra MUSSOLINI
text: in writing.- The draft regulation breaks the complicated fishing regime currently in place since 2008, which has failed to improve the state of cod stocks in the North Sea.The changes introduced take into account the introduction of the landing obligation in the plan areas and ensure greater flexibility in the definition of catches (TACs) and total allowable quotas.Therefore I expressed myself in favor of the provision.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for this recommendation regarding a regulation that establishes a long--term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks.

name: Norica NICOLAI
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of this report because it concludes the process of adopting the long-term plan for code reserves.Negotiations between the Council and the European Parliament on the tasks of the two institutions in determining the long-term plan for code reserves took place over a period of several years and were concluded only following the decision of the European Court of Justice.I believe that it is extremely important for the European Parliament to be involved in setting these long-term plans, because we need to make sure that the common fisheries policy is respected and that the objectives are achieved by adopting these plans.In this context, I believe that the inclusion in this document of the principles of maximum sustainable yield and the landing obligation are fundamental to sustainable exploitation and the achievement of the objectives of the CFP.

name: Urmas PAET
text: in writing.- I supported.The updated law regulates the requirements related to the catching and farming of cod stocks.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: in writing. - I agree with the recommendation. This Regulation implements the principles of the new Common Fisheries Policy and supports its implementation. First of all, it is necessary to ensure the sustainable exploitation of cod stocks. It is therefore necessary to apply common rules on the annual fishing opportunities for these stocks, expressed in terms of total allowable catches and maximum allowable fishing effort. It is essential that the plan is kept up to date with the most reliable scientific advice. In addition, the principle of responsibility must apply to fisheries management without exception. It is necessary to ensure that living marine biological resources are exploited in such a way as to restore and maintain populations of target species in excess of those that can ensure maximum sustainable yield. The implementation of the planned measures will ensure the conservation, sustainable exploitation and sustainable fishing of cod stocks.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of my colleagues' proposal because I believe it is right to safeguard the existence of marine fauna, in particular that of cod, by placing stock limits.In fact, one of the main concerns regarding Regulation (EC) no.1342/2008, subject of the second reading, is caused by the setting of the TAC (total allowable catch), which did not lead to a reduction in the catch of cod.Indeed, in some Member States the discard limits established in fishing activity are not respected.Furthermore, this regulation entered into force well before the Lisbon Treaty and it may have to be applied until a new mixed fisheries plan is identified.At the same time, however, I believe that the needs of EU citizens who live on fishing alone must be taken into account.I therefore voted in favor.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: written. - I support the amendment of the Council Regulation establishing a long-term plan for cod stocks and fisheries exploiting those stocks. In the scientific evaluation of the effectiveness of Council Regulation (EC) no. 1342/2008, which was implemented in 2011, states that the plan for cod stocks and fishery use of these stocks did not achieve its goals, but that there are chances that it will be achieved in 2015. The aim of these amendments is to correct shortcomings in the implementation of the Regulation, such as improving and clarifying the provisions of Regulation (EC) No 882/2004. 1342/2008, which were identified as unclear in the impact assessment. Instead of exempting vessels designated by each Member State, the exemptions are now based on criteria that would be generally applicable to all vessels, regardless of the Member States to which they belong. Thus, for example, vessels involved exclusively in fishing research are excluded from the prescribed fishing regimes. I also support efforts to reduce and phase out discards based on scientific assessments with a view to preserving fish stocks. Member States should introduce more selective fishing gear and other measures to reduce discards and will be able to do so with financial support from the European Maritime and Fisheries Fund.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: in writing.- The proposal mainly aims to improve and clarify the provisions of the Regulation.It implements the principles of the new common fisheries policy and supports its application.Basically, the old plan of 2008 provided for a complicated system of fishing efforts (days at sea) which did not allow the stocks to be restored.I am voting in favor of this reform which, for once, rather improves the situation.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: written.- In the long-running dispute over the role of the European Parliament as co-legislator in the field of fisheries policy, the European Court of Justice supported Parliament's views that multiannual management planning is decided within the usual legislative procedures, ie Article 43 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union.in achieving the objectives of the common agricultural and fisheries policy.Following the judgment of the Court of Justice of the European Union, the PECH Committee adopted a mandate for negotiations with the Council on 19 April 2016 and the case was concluded in a trialogue on 29 June 2016. On 11 July 2016, the PECH Committee accepted this agreement.policy and supports its implementation.My group supports the adoption as soon as possible of a long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries that exploit those stocks - legislative clarity is needed for fishermen.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing. - This proposal for a Regulation has been pending since the previous legislature, due to its referral to the EU Court of Justice, by disagreement between the European Parliament and the Council, on competences in relation to multiannual plans. The European Commission's original proposal foresaw the introduction of delegated acts in the following areas: adaptation of fishing mortality rates and associated biomass levels of the stock to scientific discoveries; adjustment of fishing effort in case of exclusion or re-inclusion of a group of vessels in the effort regime; specification of rules on the method of calculating fishing capacity and adjusting maximum capacity levels; and establishment of rules on the method of calculation that allows Member States to adapt the maximum authorized fishing effort in relation to quota management and following effort transfers between effort groups. The report, broadly in line with the Commission's proposal, nevertheless proposes a stricter definition of the circumstances in which the Commission can approve delegated acts, which is considered positive. It should be noted, however, that this document will be replaced by a Multispecies Plan for the region where it is applied, which will merit further and more in-depth reflection.

name: Miroslav POCHE
text: in writing. - I supported the report, which aims to ensure the sustainable exploitation of cod stocks, which need to be constantly renewed and maintained at a level that provides maximum sustainable yield. This is crucial from an environmental point of view, as the new regulation has abolished the fishing effort regime, or the number of days a fishing vessel can spend at sea. In practice, this means that vessels with a very limited number of days no longer have to fish near the coast, where predominantly juvenile fish stocks are concentrated. This is an important measure for the conservation of fish stocks, and I believe that this is another step towards the stability of the biological environment in the seas and the prevention of further climate change. On the other hand, the decision to abolish the fishing effort regime will allow fishermen more flexibility. It will allow vessels to no longer be forced to fish near the shore or in areas with a lower incidence of cod. In the present case, the Parliament has had a long-standing dispute with the Council over the choice of legal basis. Last year, the Court of Justice ruled in favor of Parliament and declared the Council regulation invalid. The Social Democrats have done an excellent job in negotiating to get this amendment to the regulation approved as soon as possible. I welcome the fact that we have succeeded in providing fishermen with greater legal certainty.

name: Franck PROUST
text: in writing.- I spoke in favor of the report on the long-term management plan for cod stocks.This plan will make it easier for cod fishermen to land all their catches.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. - On 12 September 2012, the Commission presented a proposal for a regulation, of the European Parliament and of the Council, amending Regulation 1342/2008 (COM (2012) 0498) in order to improve and clarify the provisions of the that Regulation. Regulation 1342/2008 seeks to establish a long-term plan for the cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. On 19 April 2016, the PECH Commission adopted a mandate for negotiations with the Council, the process having been concluded in a single trialogue on 29 June 2016. The agreement, which applies the principles of the new Common Fisheries Policy and supports its application, was accepted by the PECH Commission on 11 July 2016. In fact, the said agreement has as one of its advantages the simplification of the laws regarding the total allowable catches. As I believe that it is important to have clear and explicit regulations, as well as considering respect for environmental sustainability of high importance, I voted in favor.

name: Frédérique RIES
text: in writing. - This midday, Parliament approved the update of a 2008 regulation for a long-term plan for more reasoned fishing and better preservation of cod stocks. This fish, which is widespread in the Atlantic and in our European waters, has been threatened by overfishing and intensive exploitation for years. Europe accounts for 70% of the world cod market and the state of the populations in the North Sea and Ireland as well as in western Scotland remains critical despite the efforts already underway. The changes approved on Tuesday will bring a method of calculating fishing effort common to all Member States, and relax catch limits while respecting scientific advice. The aim is to reduce the incentives to discard less valuable fish, which then have a low survival rate. The restriction of this practice should promote better management of the Ichthyan populations as well as better use of exploited marine resources, and ensure the sustainability of an entire section of the European economy, since the fishing and fish processing sector employs over 350,000 people there.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: written. - Report subject to complaint before the Court of Justice of the EU (CJEU). Parliament adopted its position at first reading on 11.6.2013, pending the outcome of the CJEU ruling, which on 1.12.2015 made it clear that the Fisheries Management Plans remain under the ordinary legislative procedure, ex Article 43 (2), of the TFEU. The ruling annulled Council Regulation (EU) No. 1243/2012, which amended provisions of the Plan in articles 9 and 12 to establish fishing opportunities in situations in which the data was insufficient to establish the status of stocks, and maintained the effects of the annulled Regulation for an additional year, so that the new Regulation could be adopted on the correct legal basis during that period of time. In this way, the co-legislators adopted a text through the ordinary legislative procedure within the established period to ensure legal certainty and a compromise agreement was reached in the first and only trilogue of 29.6.2016. The revised plan is fully in line with the principles of the CFP and, to ensure legal certainty to the fishing sector, it will enter into force on 1.1.2017. I have voted in favor of the Report.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: in writing.- The multiannual plan for cod fisheries is an important document defining the objectives of managing this important resource and ecosystem component.The current cod management plan is not only an important document, but also a victory for the European Parliament in 2012-2014.managed to limit the Council's very high ambitions and, accordingly, to help halt the depletion of cod stocks.I supported the document under discussion as being in line with the long-term goals of sustainable fisheries.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report because I understand that it is an adjustment and adaptation of regulations.An introduction to delegated acts is made in the following areas: adaptation of fishing mortality rates and associated levels of biomass in the stock to scientific discoveries, adjustment of fishing effort in the event of exclusion or re-entry of a group of vessels under the regimeof effort, specification of the rules on the method of calculating fishing capacity and the adaptation of maximum capacity levels and, finally, the establishment of rules on a calculation method that allows Member States to adjust the maximum fishing effortadmissible in relation to quota management and after effort transfers.

name: Sven SCHULZE
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report establishing a long-term plan for the management of cod.The report proposes a change to the rules for determining the total allowable catches of stocks with poor data availability and looks at measures to reduce discards of fish.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: written. - I voted in favor of this new cod plan, since it simplifies the landing of catches and updates the 2008 one, burdened by the limitation of fishing effort that reduced the time that sailors could fish. With the application of the discard veto, this limit was turned into an unnecessary tool. Adapted the proposal to the new Common Fisheries Policy, this new Regulation therefore introduces a provision that obliges the Council to set the Total Allowable Catch (TAC) based on the maximum sustainable yield (MSY) and establishes that in setting the quotas in cases of insufficient data the precautionary approach must prevail. This update of the management plan for cod and the fisheries that exploit it is necessary, although it is expected to have a short life until the approval of the multi-year North Sea Plan. All this does not prevent it from accepting with prudence the impact that the landing obligation may have on the sustainability of the fishing fleets that exploit them.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing.- The new regulation aims to ensure long-term sustainable exploitation of cod stocks in compliance with the principle of maximum sustainable yield.I have decided to express myself in favor of the agreement reached between the Council and Parliament, which is a sure step towards a timely implementation of the new principles of the common fisheries policy.

name: Jill SEYMOUR
text: in writing. ‒ There was no vote on this, which shows how undemocratic this place is.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing - Following long negotiations since 2012, the European Parliament has managed to agree with the Council on a multi-annual fisheries management plan. I am glad that we have finally reached a compromise that will lead to greater legal certainty for fishermen, which is why I supported the proposal at second reading. The original proposal for a regulation was presented by the Commission in the last parliamentary term. However, the Council decided at that time to bypass Parliament and adopted a multiannual plan for cod fishing without consultation. The Commission and Parliament therefore turned to the Court of Justice, which ultimately ruled in favor of Parliament. The contested regulation was subsequently repealed and the Parliament was granted the right to co-decide directly on fishing plans. Among other measures, the compromise proposal for a regulation envisages maintaining the fishing mortality rate at a level acceptable according to scientific advice, which should allow fish stocks to recover. Similarly, Member States should develop and promote measures to prevent unwanted catches. In addition, the plan provides for exemptions for vessels that do not contribute to cod mortality, and Member States should focus on measures to reduce cod discards. As this agreement introduces the principles of the new common fisheries policy, it is time for us to take a stand on responsible catching and respect for the need to rebuild fish stocks.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: in writing. - This vote is a recommendation for a second reading on the adoption of a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Council Regulation (EC) No 1/2003. Amending Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long - term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. The purpose of that regulation is to amend and clarify certain articles of the regulation and thus to improve it. Therefore, on 12 September 2012, the European Commission published a proposal to revise the existing regulation. Unfortunately, the European Council did not follow the co-decision procedure between the European Parliament and the European Council and adopted a regulation under Article 43 (3) TFEU. Neither the European Parliament nor the European Commission agreed with this. That is why the case went to the European Court of Justice. The latter annulled the Council regulation in December 2015, which meant that the court ruled in favor of the European Parliament and the European Commission. This was a great victory for the European Parliament, which will now be the co-legislator of the regulation. Thus, in June this year, the European Parliament and the European Council reached a consensus on the said regulation, which primarily implements the principles of the new common fisheries policies and at the same time supports the implementation of the regulation in the Member States. On the basis of the above, I therefore voted in favor of the recommendation in plenary.

name: Beatrix von STORCH
text: in writing. – Although a vote was not held, had there been on I would have voted against this amendment. The common fisheries policy is not the correct means by which to tackle the problem of depleted fish stocks.  As long as the sea and resources it offers suffer from the tragedy of the commons this problem will never truly be solved.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the recommendation for second reading on the Council's position at first reading with a view to the adoption of a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Council Regulation (EC) No 1257/1999.Amending Regulation (EC) No 1342/2008 establishing a long - term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks.I support the establishment of rules on TACs and the limitation of the time that fishermen can spend at sea.The Commission proposal thus includes that all catches are taken into account in quota shares.Following the provisions of the Council, which substantially amended the Commission's text, a good compromise was thus reached between the Commission and the Council, which is in line with the new rules laid down in the new basic Regulation.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: in writing.- A common fisheries policy will protect marine fauna and flora.

name: József SZÁJER
text: in writing. - In accordance with the guidelines of the European People's Party, I, along with my Fidesz colleagues, supported the adoption without a vote of the Dodds report on the long-term plan for cod stocks and the fisheries exploiting those stocks. This step approved the legislative text finalized in the second reading agreement between the EP and the Council. New legislation is needed as the old fishing plan used a complex catch system. In practice, this has led to a deterioration of the cod stock. The new rules are more flexible in terms of TACs and fishing quotas and streamline the rules on landing obligations. Progress has also been made in tightening discards for unusable fish. 30% of the Earth's seas are overfished, and marine fish stocks are at risk. It is therefore understandable that, in order to maintain marine fish stocks, the European Union is forced to restrict sea fishing accordingly. Therefore, the Common Fisheries Policy must pay much more attention to sustainable fish farming, ie aquaculture, and in particular freshwater fish farming. A significant part of the fishponds in Hungary are located in Natura 2000 areas. These fish farms pose no threat to the natural values ​​of these areas. Moreover, in many cases it is due to our closed system of fishponds that the unique wetland associations they have created or preserved are. Consequently, freshwater aquaculture must be given priority and as much EU support as possible.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report, which aims to adapt and clarify the agreement that implements the principles of the Common Fisheries Policy and supports its implementation. The draft was also blocked by the European Commission and the European Parliament in the previous parliamentary term, as the European Council unilaterally adopted measures on fishing plans in European waters. This was followed by a ruling by the European Court of Justice finding that the European Council had erred in allocating the annual cod plan and adopting part of it unilaterally. In other words, the Council circumvented the EP as a co-decision body in the field of fisheries policy. Following the Court's ruling, the S&D Group has been actively involved in developing the principles of the cod plan, for example by introducing the precautionary principle instead of annual catch ceilings, complemented by a system of fishing authorization and fishing overcapacity. However, the draft regulation would put an immediate end to the days-at-sea cod fishing practice, which is a major contributor to depletion. This material is fully in line with the reformed Common Fisheries Policy, it could enter into force on 1 January 2017 and we can ensure legal certainty for fishermen.

name: Claudiu Ciprian TĂNĂSESCU
text: signed up. - Efforts to replenish cod stocks in EU waters cannot be effective if there is no cooperation from all stakeholders and they do not assume their responsibilities to reduce fishing mortality and the negative impact on the EU community. the respective fishing areas. To this end, Member States should give priority to the development and promotion of (financial) measures and incentives with a view to avoiding unwanted catches and the use of selective fishing gear, with the financial support of the European Fisheries and Maritime Fund. Member States should also make efforts to identify (through the STECF process) the tools whose characteristics lead to the reduction or elimination of by-catches of cod and to transfer the knowledge gained to other Member States so that it is possible to restore cod stocks. Obviously, in substantiating a long-term plan for restocking cod stocks, it must be borne in mind that fully documented fishing activities have yielded results and that variations can be developed, with beneficial effects on cod stocks and areas. related fish.

name: Claudia ȚAPARDEL
text: signed up. - The Common Fisheries Policy (CFP) of the European Union has been developed to give the people involved in this sector the opportunity to make the most of this work. To this end, in September 2012 the Commission came up with a proposal for a regulation to maintain the cod stocks needed for the reproduction of the species and the sustainability of fishing activity, a proposal supported by Parliament. Unfortunately, the Council did not agree with this proposal, which created an institutional deadlock until the decision of the European Court of Justice in December 2015. The Court's decision upheld the position of the Commission and Parliament, confirming the institutional framework established by The Lisbon Treaty and the role of the European Parliament in shaping European fisheries policy. In these circumstances, the new revised regulation will enter into force on 1 January 2017 and will provide more security and clarity in this important area. That is why I support the immediate adoption of this report.

name: Marc TARABELLA
